title: monoco_(clair_obscur:_expedition_33)
body:
One of the main characters in [[Clair Obscur: Expedition 33]].

A large [[Gestral]] with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[doll joints]] and a [[mask]] for a head. Has a habit of collecting Nevrons' feet, enabling him to transform into them in battle.

title: kaela_kovalskia
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[holoh3roes|3rd generation]]. An apprentice of a famous blacksmith who joined the secret agency in search of a legendary material. Designed by [[Yasuda Suzuhito]].

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] [[red eyes]] and [[medium breasts]] (although to the revealing nature of her default outfits artist tend to exaggerate her bust size). Her default hairstyle has [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[swept bangs]] and a [[single sidelock]] on her right and is decorated with a [[red hairband]] and a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]], she also wears a pair of [[red-tinted eyewear|red]] [[sunglasses]] styled after welding goggles [[eyewear on head|on her head]].

title: bellemere
body: A minor character from the backstory of the manga and anime [[One Piece]]. She was a marine who found the war orphans [[Nami (One Piece)|]] and [[Nojiko (one piece)|]] on the battlefield, and left the marines to adopt them. Later, she was [[murder]]ed by the villainous pirate [[Arlong]].

title: ibaraki_douji_(touhou)
body:
The true form of [[Ibaraki Kasen]] after she fused with her [[Ibaraki Douji's Arm|once missing arm]].

Her appearance is mostly the same except that she now has manacles with [[Ball And Chain Restraint]]s on each limb. Her dress [[Sleeveless|no longer has sleeves]] and is now longer and colored white, with her [[Tabard]] having turned a much darker color. She has also gained a pair of [[Horns]] and her hair has [[Long Hair|grown much longer]].

title: crayon_shin-chan
body:
A manga series drawn by [[Usui Yoshito]] serialized in [i]Manga Action[/i] from August 1990 to March 2010. With an anime adaptation by [i]Shin-Ei Animation[/i] that began Spring 1992. Rather (in)famous for its plethora of toilet humor.

The series follows the adventures of 5 year old, Shinnosuke with his family and friends. They live in Kasukabe, Saitama Prefecture, Japan.

title: mococo_abyssgard
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and one of the Twin Demonic Guard Dogs of hololive English [[holoadvent|Advent]], the third generation of [[hololive English]], along with her older twin sister [[Fuwawa Abyssgard]]. Designed by [[Icomochi]].

She's a [[dog girl]] with both [[dog ears]] and a [[dog tail|tail]]. She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default hairstyle is a [[two side up]] with [[hair intakes]] and [[crossed bangs|crossed]] [[double-parted bangs]] [[hair between eyes|reaching between her eyes]], decorated with a [[pink hairband|pink]] [[horn hairband]] a [[bandaid hair ornament]] and an [[x hair ornament]].

She can be distinguished from Fuwawa by her shorter hair with pink streaks and her smaller breasts.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[split-color hair|split-color]] [[black hair|black]] and [[grey hair]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. title: nerissa_ravencroft
body:

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair]], [[purple eyes|purple eyes]] with [[slit pupils]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]], [[large breasts]], [[uneven horns]] (canonically she had one of her horns broken to reduce her power) decorated with small [[horn flower|flowers]], and [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[low wings]]. title: medusa_(fate)
body:
A catch-all tag for all versions of Medusa across the [[Fate (series)|Fate series]].

h4. Variations

* [[Medusa (Rider) (fate)|]] - Original version from [[Fate/Stay Night]] and [[Fate/Hollow Ataraxia]], otherwise known as just "Rider".
* [[Medusa (Lancer) (Fate)|]] - Younger Lancer-class version, appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]].
* [[Medusa Alter (fate)|]] - Alter version, appearing only in [[Fate/Grand Order: First Order]].
* [[Gorgon (Fate)]] - Monstrous Avenger-class version, appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]].
* [[Medusa (Saber) (Fate)|]] - Saber-class version, appearing in  [[Fate/Grand Order]].

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Medusa":[https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Medusa]

title: medusa_(shingeki_no_bahamut)
body:
A character that appears in  [[Shingeki no Bahamut]], [[Granblue Fantasy]], [[Shadowverse]], and [[Princess Connect!]].

A mighty sorceress with an accursed petrifying gaze has landed, bearing the form of a sweet young girl. She comes with both great magical power and pride befitting a primal beast, but what will she impose on the people? Trials, destruction, or merely a bit of fun?

Although she'd be the last to admit it, this primal beast savors her time with her primal pals. However, an unexpected encounter with a young girl takes her down unexpected paths—is there room in this primal beast's heart to grow from a new experience?

h4.Official Alternate Costumes

* [[medusa_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)|Summer Medusa]]
* [[medusa_(valentine)_(granblue_fantasy)|Valentines Medusa]]
other_names: メドゥーサ(神撃のバハムート)

title: medusa_(jashin-chan_dropkick)
body: A demon from Hell, and [[Jashin-chan]]'s best friend. Medusa has [[short_hair|short]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]], and is usually dressed in [[Ancient egyptian clothes]] with an [[Usekh collar]] and [[no_bra|no visible bra]]. Sometimes seen with a [[paper bag]] over her head, as a means to stop her petrifying gaze. Nicknamed "ATM" (acronym varies) for her constant enabling of Jashin-chan's worst vices.
other_names: メデューサ(邪神ちゃんドロップキック)

title: medusa_(mythology)
body:
One of the gorgons of [[Greek mythology]], and the only one who could be killed. 
She was beheaded by the Greek hero [[Perseus (mythology)|]] and her blood, splattered during the beheading, gave birth to [[Pegasus]] and Chrysaor.

For generic gorgons/characters with snake hair, use [[snake hair]].

When her power is shown, use [[petrification]].

title: mage_staff
body:
An ornate [[staff]] often carried by [[magic]] users, and used as focusing implement for [[casting spell]]s. Often decorated with [[gem]]s, [[crystal]]s and metal bands; or is carved from gnarled wood with knobbly/curly projections at the end. Sometimes both.

Not to be confused with a [[wand]], [[scepter]] or [[crosier]].

title: type-moon
body:
Type-Moon is a Japanese media company founded by [[Nasu Kinoko]] and [[Takeuchi Takashi]].

Originally founded as an eroge doujin circle, it's best known for hits like [[tsukihime|Tsukihime]] and [[fate/stay night|Fate/stay night]]. The former was created when Type-Moon was a mere hobbyist group, whereas the latter's success has established the circle into an established gaming and media company.

This tag is applicable when posts featured references to multiple series done by TYPE-MOON, as well as a reference to its staff.

h4. Related artists
* [[Aotsuki Takao]]

* [[Higurashi Ryuuji]]

h4. Related copyrights

body:
The [[official alternate costume|official]] [[swimsuit]] worn by [[hololive]] members for the hololive Summer 2023 event.

This time, they invited the public to submit swimsuit designs as part of ""hololive Creator Contest 2023":[https://www.pixiv.net/contest/hololive2023]," and [[Naka]]'s design (pixiv #105325141) was chosen. It is a [[layered bikini]] consisting of a color-coded [[striped bikini]] with a [[front-tie bikini top]] and a [[highleg bikini|highleg]] bottom, worn under a [[white bikini]] with blue straps and either [[blue shorts|dark blue]]/[[black shorts]] or a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[bikini skirt]], both of them with a color-coded [[overskirt]] and small [[waist bow]], a color-coded [[thigh strap]] and [[open-toe boots]].

title: toonami
body:
A programming block on the [[Cartoon Network]]/[[Adult Swim]] channel, geared towards airing action animation, generally manifesting itself in more action-oriented Western cartoons and, famously, anime. It originally ran from 1997 to 2008 on Cartoon Network, before a 2012 Adult Swim Toonami-themed April Fools would lead to the block being revived that same year, and running on Adult Swim ever since.

The block was originally hosted by the [[Space Ghost (series)|Space Ghost Coast to Coast]] incarnation of Moltar, before the [[Toonami Operations Module]], or TOM, debuted in 1999 to take over hosting responsibilities. TOM has switched bodies several times since his debut.

On Cartoon Network Japan, Toonami existed as a block from 2002 (during TOM 2's run) up to 2008 when it was cancelled around the same time as the US original was. TOM was subtitled in his appearances there. In 2018, for Adult Swim's April Fools, Toonami would partially air in Japanese, with TOM being voiced by Masa Kanome.

h4. Toonami/Warner anime co-productions in release order

* [[The Big O]] (anime, season 2)

title: nimi_nightmare_(2nd_costume)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Nimi Nightmare]].

It's an [[idol]] outfit consisting of a [[white dress]] with a [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]], a longer [[see-through skirt]] and a [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[overskirt]] with a [[white bow]], [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[see-through sleeves]], [[white wrist cuffs]] with [[see-through frills]], [[green shoes|dark green]] [[high heels]] with [[glow-in-the-dark]] soles and a [[hairband]] with a [[mini hat|mini]] [[nurse cap]] ornament.

She also wears green [[glow-in-the-dark]] [[carnation]]s on her [[hair flower|hair]], her [[flower on chest|chest]], her [[footwear flower|right ankle]], the [[bow flower|bow]] on her left hip and her lower back. The [[see-through clothes|see-through]] parts of the outfit, as well as the overskirt, the also gain a [[starry sky print]] in the dark.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, it's normally the same as her [[nimi nightmare (1st costume)|default hairstyle]], but she can have it turn [[black hair|black]] when she's glowing in the dark.

h4. Appearance

title: to_be_continued
body:
Phrase included when a written or drawn work is incomplete and will be continued in the next illustration or comic. Also included at the end of a TV episode when a story had to be cut short due to time constraints, usually at a cliffhanger situation.

Gained [[meme|memetic fame]] when [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] used the text within an arrow (together with giving the final frame [[sepia]] tones) to end most episodes (typically on a cliffhanger) of the anime adaptations with, together with "the opening riff":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPCLFtxpadE&t=40s of the song "[[Roundabout (song)|]]" by [[Yes (band)|]] as the first season's ending.

A similar memetic format is used in [[The Eric Andre Show]] at the end of its segments where the scene freezes abruptly with the text "We'll Be Right Back", alongside the song "Oregon Spirit" by Rolf Kruger.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23040127: The Famous JJBA "To be continued"

h4. See Also

* pool #7229 - Cliffhanger

title: janus_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] J-class destroyer HMS [i]Janus[/i] (F53). Character design by [[Mimoza (96mimo414)|]], voiced by [[Kino Hina]]. 

She is named after "Janus":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janus], a Roman deity.

In-game, she has [[long hair|long]] [[light blue hair]] tied in [[braid|braided]] [[low twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[medium breasts|modestly-sized chest]].

Her outfit consists of a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[white dress]] with a [[red ribbon]] holding the dress in place, [[detached sleeves]] exposing her [[bare shoulders]], [[white thighhighs]] with additional red ribbons acting as [[thigh strap|thigh straps]], and a white [[collar]]. She also holds a [[staff]] much like her older sister [[Jervis (Azur Lane)|]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of a 120 mm twin gun mount QF Mk7 and her bridge (and associated fire control director) to her right, 53.3 cm quintuple [[torpedo tubes]] and a funnel to her left, held together by a hull piece to her back that contains her [[depth charge]] roller racks.

h4. Appearance

title: ganondorf
body:
Primary antagonist of [[The Legend of Zelda]] series, possessing the Triforce of Power. Has a bestial form, [[Ganon]], a pig/boar incarnation.

Introduced in [[The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time]], Ganondorf was a member of the [[Gerudo]] tribe and consistently one of the rare few males born.

h4. Appearance

title: family_computer_robot
body:
[b]Family Computer Robot[/b] (Japanese), [b]Robotic Operating Buddy (R.O.B.)[/b] (English)

An accessory for the [[Famicom]]/[[NES]]. He also appears in [[Mario Kart]] [[Mario Kart DS|DS]] and [[Super Smash Bros.]] as a playable character.

In Japan, the accessory is known as the [[Famicom]] Robot (shortened to simply "Robot" for his [i]Mario Kart[/i] and [i]Super Smash. Bros.[/i] appearances).

[[2channel]] denizens often use his [[ascii art]] for this nonsensical [[meme]] phrase: 奇蹟のカーニバル 開 幕 だ (Miracle carnival is starting [i]N O W[/i])

h4.External links

* [[maso_(ascii_art)|]]'s "illustration page":http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/FamicomRobo.html

title: pyoitto_hallelujah!
body:
The ending theme song for the [[Umamusume]] spin-off short [[Umayon]] originally performed by [[Golden Generation (umamusume)|]], which was later ported to the main game as one of the playable songs on the Live Theater.

As the dance act involves 3 of the characters going down a slide regardless of whether it'd be in character for them to do so otherwise, the slide has been infamously nicknamed "[b]The Slide of Destroying Dignity[/b] (尊厳破壊滑り台)" by fans.

h4. External Links

* "Youtube: Pyoitto Hareruya Music Video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jvQ21x7AGiU]; the offending slide makes its appearance at around the 1:28 mark.

title: luigi_(casino)
body:
A formal dealer/tuxedo outfit worn by [[Luigi]] during the casino-themed card and roulette minigames in [[Super Mario 64 DS]] and [[New Super Mario Bros.]] These minigames show Luigi serving as the croupier. This outfit consists of:

* Standard green cap with white “L” emblem
* White dress shirt and gloves
* Black waistcoat and matching trousers
* Bright green bow tie (matches his cap)
* Single gold medallion/button at the vest’s waist
* Brown work shoes

title: narwhal_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [[Kemono Friends]] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Narwhal ([i]Monodon monoceros[/i]) is a medium-sized toothed whale known for their massive tusk, usually a left canine. Note that the males are typically the ones with a tusk. Females do, however, occasionally grow a tusk. They live in the Arctic seas.

Narwhal (the Friend) wears a [[sailor dress]] with the distinctive pattern of the Narwhal, fitting with the usual "Marine Fashion" motif of the cetacean Friends. She wields right-handedly [[drillhorn sword|a lance or sword based on the Narwhal's tusk]]. Her hair is styled like the front and fins of the Narwhal, including a blowhole and a long lock of hair to her left representing her actual tusk. Of course, she has the tail of the Narwhal.
other_names: イッカク(けものフレンズ)

title: hero_(dq1)
body:
The hero of [[Dragon Quest I]], descendant of [[Roto (dq3)|]]/Erdrick, vanquisher of the [[Dragon Lord]] and, along with [[Princess Laura]], the ancestor of the [[Dragon Quest II|DQ2]] heroes.

While his ancestor codified the very concept of a JRPG hero, he laid the foundations.

[Spoilers] In [[Dragon Quest Builders]], he appears as a boss. He takes the appearance of a [[hood_(dragon quest)|Hood]] with red clothing instead of green and a cape. [/spoilers]

body:
The [b]Toughie[/b], alternatively referred to as [b]Arakure[/b] or [b]Thugs[/b], is a class of non-player characters that are present throughout the [[Dragon Quest]] series. Their attire often consists of [[horned mask]]s, [[o-ring harness]]', and [[spiked bracelet]]s. Today, Kanye has become a notorious figure due his erratic behavior, controversial views about women and race, grudge against [[Taylor Swift]] and now has been blacklisted by many due to proclaiming himself as a White Supremacist, praising [[Adolf Hitler]] and spewing anti-Semitic rants online.

title: sugar_lyric
body:
A [[virtual Youtuber]] group of [[Nanashi Inc.]], sister group to [[Honey Strap]]. They are a group of [[demon girl|demon]] detectives, named after both notable demons in Japanese folklore, and notable members of the mystery genre. Anna, Rene, and Chris debuted in April 2020 while Tier and May debuted in December 2022, two weeks after Anna disbanded. They were later entirely integrated into Nanashi Inc. on March 21, 2023 alongside the other groups.

h4. Members
* [[Kojo Anna]] (disbanded in December 2022, remained in 774 inc.)

title: st._bernard
body:
A large breed of [[dog]] originating from the Alps, notable for alpine rescue missions, and for carrying small barrels of brandy for rescue victims (according to popular culture). It has an enormous size and very thick fur colored white and brown.

Notable St. Bernards in anime include [[Inumi]] from [[Idolmaster]].

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Dogs]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: St. Bernard":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Bernard_%28dog%29

title: moscow
body:
[b]Moscow[/b] (/ˈmɒskaʊ/ or /ˈmɒskoʊ/; Russian: Москва, tr. Moskva; IPA: [mɐˈskva]) is the capital city of Russia. 

The city is a major political, economic, cultural and scientific center in [[Russia]] and Eurasia.

h4. See Also
* [[Kremlin]]
* [[Red Square]]
* [[st. basil's cathedral|Saint Basil's Cathedral]]

title: st._basil's_cathedral
body:
Church located in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]], noted for it's distinctive architecture and design. 

Often used as a common image to represent Russia by other countries, and is commonly confused with (and mistakenly named as) the [[Kremlin]] complex that serves as the residence and office of the Russian president.

title: sin_sack
body:
The [b]Sin Sack[/b] is a [[faceless male]] mob character originated from [[Touhou]] fandom. They wear a [[sack]] over their head marked with the character 罪 ([i]Tsumi[/i], or "Sin"). As a result, they are referred to as 罪袋/[i]Tsumi-fukuro[/i], which literally means "sin bag" or "sin sack".

They are frequently depicted as [[pervert]]ed followers of various female characters. In recent times, they are most commonly seen on various NSFW [[mikumikudance|MMD]] videos (particularly those from the [[Iwara.tv]] website), where they are used as a generic male mob characters.

title: feet_up
body:

If you just see one or both legs being raised but can't see the feet, use [[legs up]] instead.

body:

For one foot being lifted up in the air, use [[leg up]] instead.  For the toes being lifted with the heel on the ground, use [[toes up]]. For the heel being lifted with the toes on the ground, see [[heel up]].

title: family
body:
A social unit composed of parents and their children (at least one).

Parents don't necessarily need to be biological, guardians are fine too as long as they are part of the same household.
In case one of the parents is deceased this tag may be used with only one parent and their children. 

Additionally grandparents and extended family may be included in the image, but only if the family itself is complete.
Complete being all living parents and their children. 

[b]When it's only a single parent with one child use the following tags instead:[/b]
* [[mother and daughter]] 
* [[mother and son]] 
* [[father and daughter]] 
* [[father and son]] 
* [[grandfather and grandson]]
* [[grandfather and granddaughter]]
* [[grandmother and grandson]]
* [[grandmother and granddaughter]]

title: azuma_himari_(mato_seihei_no_slave)
body:
Character in [[Mato Seihei no Slave]]. Has [[yellow eyes]] and [[blue hair|blue]]-[[green hair|green]] [[long hair]] with part tied in [[hair rings]]. Usually wears the [[Anti-Demon Corps uniform]].

Member of the Mato Defense Corps 7th Division. Her Mato Peach ability, "Lofty Ambitions: [b]Learning[/b]," lets her copy others' Peach abilities to an extent depending on her compatibility with the techniques; her usual go-to is [[Tokoroyama Saki]]'s "[b]Bang Bang Bang[/b]," which turns her limbs and/or hair into weapons.

Not to be confused with the [[Azuma Himari (Saint Dorei Gakuen 2)|]] of [[Saint Dorei Gakuen 2]].

title: muscular
body:
For the actual muscle tissue under the skin (such as seen in [[anatomy]] pictures), please use [[exposed muscle]]. For unknown pink tissue that doesn’t have the lines seen in muscle tissue, use [[flesh]].

Noticeably developed musculature that must have come from extensive training, body building or otherwise. The body has visually "bulked up" and has become obviously thicker.

* [b] Comparison with [[toned]][/b]
Details like bulkiness of the [[thick arms |arms]], [[thick neck|neck]], [[strongman waist|waist]] and [[broad shoulders]] are a good way to distinguish between [[toned]] and [[muscular]] builds.

[i]Do not use [/i][[pectorals]] size alone as a determinant for this tag. It is common in artwork to draw them disproportionately to the rest of the body, especially with [[manboobs]] etc.

* !post #7055700
* !asset #13418660
* !post #4668612
* !post #4200789

h4. Examples

h6.  [u] Muscular [/u]

* !post #7450561 
* !post #7439977 
* !post #2267407 
* !post #7423902 


h6.  [u] Plump muscular [/u]

If the physique is muscular with a [[belly]] like many wrestlers and bodybuilders, consider adding the [[plump]], [[belly]] and/or [[strongman waist]] tag as well.

* !post #6019922 
* !post #4239595 
* !post #4894623 
* !post #7443599


h6.  [u] Toned physique [/u]

If the character has an athletic build that’s not overly bulky, use [[toned]] instead. Do not use [[muscular]] with the [[toned]] tag when describing one character. 

* !post #7387759 
* !post #7492264

title: monk
body:
A character who is a member of a religious order and lives in a monastery, usually celibate male. He usually lives his life in prayer and contemplation. The concept is ancient and can be seen in many religions like [[Christianity]] (mainly Catholicism and Orthodoxy), [[Buddhism]], etc.. The female counterpart is [[nun]].

This tag may also apply to females wearing monk attire.
For tagging purpose, friars can be included within this tag despite the real-world canonical difference of their order and lifestyle.

h4. Examples
* !post #9413760: What appears to be a Catholic monk.
* !post #1060100: [[Buddhism|Buddhist]] monk.
* !post #8961717: An Eastern Orthodox monk wearing a robe (left).

title: clochafarmore
body: The stone depicted in [[Celtic mythology]] where [[Cu Chulainn]] died. As he bled out to death, he tied himself to the stone so he would die standing. His enemies dared not approach him until the goddess Morrigan took the form of a raven and landed on his shoulder, confirming that it was safe for them to approach the dead warrior.

title: twisted_metal
body:
Twisted Metal is a series of vehicular combat video games published by Sony Computer Entertainment, and developed by various companies for the PlayStation, PlayStation 2, PlayStation Portable and PlayStation 3. 

The games follow Calypso, the mysterious host of a deadly vehicular combat tournament called "Twisted Metal", with the promise of granting the winner whatever they ask for if they win the tournament.

A live action television adaptation staring Anthony Mackie aired on Peacock in 2023. Unlike the video games, the tv show is a post-apocalyptic dark comedy which features characters from the games. Despite being different from it's source, the show was a surprise hit with a second season airing in 2025 which includes the actual Twisted Metal tournament hosted by Calypso.

title: pokemon_rejuvenation
body:
[[Pokemon]] Rejuvenation is a heavily story driven Generation 3 styled game with over 80 hours worth of gameplay, featuring content all the way through Generation 8. Battle your way through countless trainers and rise to the top! Travel through the brand new Aevium region alongside many new friends and allies you meet during your journey, while also fighting to protect it from the evil forces that vow to cut down Aevium's reign of prosperity and peace. 

h4. External links

* "Website":https://www.rebornevo.com/rejuvenation/

title: primal_sunflower_(plants_vs_zombies)
body:
The primal version of the sunflower from Plants vs. Zombies 2: It's About Time. Since the story premise of this game is time travel, temporal equivalents of the game's characters appear, with traits depending on the era. The primal version of the plants appears in the Jurassic Swamp world. In this world, prehistoric versions of several plants are introduced.

Primal Sunflower is the fourth plant obtained in Jurassic Marsh. She is the primal version of Sunflower. She produces 75 sun instead of 50, but she also costs 25 more sun than her modern counterpart. She produces 25 more sun in Jurassic Marsh in the Chinese version of Plants vs. Zombies 2. 

Almanac Entry:
    
Primal Sunflowers pop out large suns instead of regular ones. Primal Sunflower is new to all this sun-giving business, so be patient with her. She's an early adopter of the all-you-can-stuff-yourself buffet style of sun production.

Chinese version  (China only)

    原始向日葵会产出大号太阳[sic]，而不是普通太阳[sic]。

    日光[sic]产出：大号太阳
    植物特征：黄色植物、狂野生长、无尽阳光

    原始向日葵刚来到日光产出行业，所以请对她耐心一点。她在阳光制造产业中不限量自助餐厅的早期试用者。
    In English:
    Primal Sunflower will produce large-sized sun, not normal sun.

    Sunlight Production: large suns
    Plant feature: yellow plant, wild growth, infinite sun. 

Primal Sunflower is new to the business of sunlight production, so be patient with her. She is an early trial user of the unlimited buffet restaurant from sun production business.

title: beatnik
body:
A social movement and associated [[fashion]] style from the 1950s, focused on intellectualism and anti-materialism. The fashion worn by members of the subculture was highly minimalist, utilizing palettes of black, white, greys and browns.

[[Beret]]s and [[turtleneck sweater]]s are most associated with the style, though other common elements include striped clothing, [[sunglasses]], [[pencil skirt]]s, [[blazer]]s, and patterned [[handbag]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Beatnik":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beatnik

title: primordial_albedo
body:
A quest-exclusive NPC from [[Genshin Impact]] who appeared in the Version 2.3 event Shadows Amidst Snowstorms.

He is a previous iteration of [[Albedo (genshin impact)|]] created by [[Rhinedottir (genshin impact)|]] as a result of her Primordial Human Project, but was deemed a failure and consumed by [[Durin (real) (genshin impact)|Durin]]. Eventually he escaped after Durin's death, and witnessed Albedo living among humans and grew envious, concocting a plan to replace him. He created the Fellflower to distract Albedo, intending to eliminate him and take his place, though it was defeated by the Traveler. He is later confronted by Albedo and eventually killed by him.

He is distinguishable from the real Albedo by the lack of a golden star-shaped [[birthmark|mark]] on his neck.

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Subject Two":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Subject_Two

body:
A boss from [[Genshin Impact]].

The Golden Wolflord is the king of the [[Rifthound (genshin impact)|Riftwolves]] and commands a large pack on Tsurumi Island in Inazuma. Unlike the other riftwolves, it was created by [[Rhinedottir (genshin impact)|]] unintentionally. It deals Geo damage and like the other riftwolves, it's attacks apply the corrosion debuff, continuously draining HP from all party members.

title: sideways
body:
An image where the viewer's point of view is placed at a sideways angle.

This tag is for points of view that are tilted at a 90 degree angle, or close to it. For less tilted images, use [[dutch angle]] instead.

* [[Exif rotation]] (images that are displayed as rotated via metadata)
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

title: dutch_angle
body:
An image that is framed at a tilted angle. Often used to fit tall characters into a wide image. The technique may also be used to make an image appear more dynamic or visually interesting.

The term originates in filmmaking, and is also known as the German angle or Batman angle.

Basically if you find yourself tilting your head to one side in order to see the picture in proper perspective, this tag is appropriate. If the image is tilted at a 90 degree angle, use [[sideways]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #4243732: Dutch angle
* !post #4243734: No dutch angle

h4. See also

* [[perspective]]
* [[fisheye]]
* [[Tag group:Image Composition]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dutch angle":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dutch_angle]

title: rifthound_(genshin_impact)
body:
An enemy group from [[Genshin Impact]]. 

Riftwolves are monsters from the Abyss that behave biologically similar to [[wolf|wolves]] and are said to erode the boundaries of the world. They were very prevalent during the Cataclysm and were hunted to low numbers after. Riftwolves are one of [[Rhinedottir (genshin impact)|]]'s many creations and she classified them as "Alfisol".

Their attacks apply a corrosion debuff which ignores shields and continuously drains HP from all party members.

h4. Types

title: kamen_rider_amazon
body:
The sole protagonist of the fourth television series in the [[Kamen Rider]] franchise.

Adopted by a local tribe after surviving a plane crash in the Amazon rainforest, he returns to Japan to take back a sacred armlet that had been stolen from his village.

A departure from his cyborg predecessors, Amazon resembles a combination of a giant lizard and possibly a piranha (people are still not sure). Despite his unique look, he still retains the traditional [[scarf]] and [[compound eyes]] of a Kamen Rider.

h4. Special moves
* Dai-Setsudan: Slash the target with the fins on his arms or legs.
* Jaguar Shock: [[biting|Bite]] the target.
* Monkey Attack: [[Scratching|Scratche]] the target.
* Condor Jump: A high jump that can reach a maximum of 50.0 m in the standing long jump and 80.0 m in the standing high jump.
* Amazon Kick: [[flying kick|Flying]] [[Rider Kick]].

title: judas_iscariot
body:
In [[Christianity]], Judas Iscariot was one of the original Twelve Apostles of Jesus Christ. Judas betrayed [[Jesus]] to the Sanhedrin in the Garden of Gethsemane, in exchange for thirty pieces of silver, by kissing him on the cheek and addressing him as "master" to reveal his identity in the darkness to the crowd who had come to arrest him. 

In modern times, his name is often used synonymously with [[betrayal]] or treason.

title: altering_(agito)
body:
[[Kamen Rider Agito]]'s [[rider belt]].
The buckle of it changes to a different color for each form, and weapons can be taken out of it.

* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Ground Form)|Ground]] or [[Kamen Rider Agito (Trinity Form)|Trinity form]]: buckle is golden.
* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Storm Form)|Storm form]]: buckle is blue, from which the [[Storm Halberd]] emerges.
* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Flame Form)|Flame form]]: buckle is red, from which the [[Flame Saber (kamen rider)|]] emerges.
* [[Kamen Rider Agito (Burning Form)|Burning]] or [[Kamen Rider Agito (Shining Form)|Shining form]]: buckle is purple and three grappling claws, the “Dragon's Nails,” are added. The [[Shining Caliber]] (Emerge Mode) emerges from it.

title: kamen_rider_agito_(flame_form)
body:
This is one of the forms of [[Kamen Rider Agito]].
He is characterized by a red discoloration of his chest armor, right arm, and the center of the buckle of the [[Altering (agito)|]].
He has less running and jumping ability than his [[Kamen Rider Agito (Ground Form)|Ground Form]] , but has enhanced physical strength, defense and five senses.
His weapon is the [b][[Flame Saber (kamen rider)|]] [/b], a [[Sword]] that appears from Altering.
His special move is [b]Saber Slash[/b], in which he unfolds the guard of his Flame Saber like a fan, heats the blade to high heat, and slashes down the enemy. The enhanced version of this special move exists, called the [b]Double Saber Slash[/b], in which the attack is slashed with [[dual wielding|two Sabers]].

title: sacred_heart
body:
Intelligent device of [[Vivio]], from the series [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha Vivid]]. Appears in the form of a [[stuffed rabbit]], but actually contains a [[crystal]] similar to [[Raising Heart]]. It allows Vivio to transform into her [[aged up]] form at will.

Not to be confused with a Christian symbol of "the same name.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacred_Heart
other_names: セイクリッド・ハート

title: blade_blade
body:
This is the form of [[Kamen Rider Blade]] when he transforms into a [[huge weapon|large]] [[sword]] using the effect of the [[Rider Card]] "[[Final Form Ride]] Blade."
The tip of the sword is the [[Blay Rouzer]].

It is capable of activating "[[kamen rider decade|Decade]] Edge" or "[[Kamen Rider Diend|Diend]] Edge", the finishers that slashes the target while discharging electricity from the blade.

title: st._javelin
body:
A personification of the [[FGM-148 Javelin]] that began to appear on social media following the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian Invasion of Ukraine]]. Ukraine had received hundreds of the anti-tank missiles in the lead-up to the invasion, which would prove to be highly effective against Russian armor. Because of this, social media observers began expressing joking religious reverence for the weapon. Saint Javelin is usually portrayed as a variant on the [[Virgin Mary]], with her holding the launcher instead of the infant Christ.

h4. See also

* [[St. Inger]] ([[FIM-92 Stinger]])

title: virgin_mary
body:
According to the Gospels, the wife of Joseph and mother of [[Jesus]]. [[christianity|Catholic]] tradition believes she was conceived without original sin and remained a perpetual virgin even after giving birth to Jesus. Mary is the only woman explicitly mentioned by name in the Quran and is considered a figure of exceptional sanctity in Islam.

Commonly depicted wearing a [[veil]].

In 2022, a derivative depiction of her (itself based on Orthodox art of her holding Baby Jesus one-armed) drawn by "Chris Shaw":[https://chrisshawstudio.com/2013/04/chris-shaw-at-the-san-francisco-museum-of-modern-art/] from 2012, known as 'Madonna Kalashnikov', was drawn over to depict her holding a [[FGM-148 Javelin]], in reference to the successful usage of Javelins by the Ukrainians [[russo-ukrainian war|against]] the Russians. This edit of her would quickly spread, dubbed [[St. Javelin]]. Another variant would emerge in this style, except instead wielding the [[FIM-92 Stinger]], dubbed [[St. Inger]].

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:People]]

title: diamond_(gemstone)
body:
A type of precious [[crystal]] [[gem|gemstone]] known for its hardness.

For tagging purposes this should be used for crystals that have been cut into an organized shape, particularly a shape used in jewelry.

For the ♦️ symbol or the [[playing card]] suit, use [[diamond (shape)]].
For the 💎 symbol seen on [[Idolmaster]] character cards, see [[gem (symbol)|]].

title: traditional_youkai
body:
A class of preternatural creatures in Japanese folklore. Since many copyrights have elements based on mythology, only use this tag for classical depictions of the youkai. An anime girl that is stated to be a youkai and only has barely noticeable connections to said youkai does not get this tag, unless the youkai is humanoid to begin with.

Notable characteristics are: humans (transformed), shapeshifters, animals, ogres, and even inanimate objects.

h4. List of Youkai

title: japanese_urban_legends
body:
Stories in Japanese folklore which are circulated as true. These urban legends are characterized by originating in or being popularized throughout the country of Japan. These urban legends commonly involve paranormal entities or creatures who encounter and attack humans, but the term can Mau and other creatures are not known for being a part or also encompass widespread, non-supernatural rumors in popular culture. Urban legends in the former category rarely include the folklore youkai, instead of being primarily based on contemporary examples of yuurei (Japanese ghosts). Modern Japanese urban legends tend to occur in schools or urban settings, and some can be considered cautionary tales.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Some of the most popular urban legends today have their origins on [[2channel]]'s Occult Board (オカルト超常現象, or OkaBoard, オカ板), specifically from the "Let's gather up seriously, deadly scary stories, shall we?" thread (死ぬ程洒落にならない怖い話を集めてみない?, often shortened to just 洒落怖, or Sharekowa).

h4. Examples of Japanese urban legends

* [[Toire no Hanako-san]]
* [[Kuchisake-onna]]
* [[Mary-san]]
* [[Aka Manto]]
* [[Teke-teke]]
* [[Kune-kune]]
* Sharekowa:
** [[Hasshaku-sama]]
** [[Kankandara]]

title: ex-rumia
body:
A fanmade character based off of [[Rumia]] from [[Touhou]].

It has been speculated that the ribbon on Rumia's head acts as a seal on her true powers.

In EX form, her ribbon usually becomes a [[halo]], and she commonly wields a large sword (most likely "Stormbringer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stormbringer]) and freely manipulates darkness. She is also sometimes depicted as an adult and/or with wings in this form. It is also not uncommon to see her ribbon floating above her head in a similar fashion to a halo. She becomes more mature and more serious in this form.

EX-Rumia prominently featured as the main character of the fanwork [[Osana Reimu]], and the antagonist of its sequel [[Reireimu]].

h4. See Also
* [[Rumia (Youkai of the Darkest Dusk)]] - [[Touhou LostWord]]'s take on this concept.

title: alice_margatroid_(scarlet)
body:
An [[alternate costume]]/[[alternate universe]] variation of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[Touhou LostWord]].
She hails from [b]A6 Universe[/b], where the incident of [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] never ends.

Her look seems to be a fusion between her canonical appearance in [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and [[Alice Margatroid (Pc-98)|PC-98 version of herself]] in [[Mystic Square]].

title: kirisame_marisa_(witch_of_scarlet_dreams_on_vacation)
body:
Alternate identity of an alternate identity, based on [[Kirisame Marisa (Witch of Scarlet Dreams)]] of [[Touhou LostWord]].

She has several [[scar]]s on her body which were caused by heat exploding out of her body when she first became The Witch of Scarlet Dream, although this detail were often missed or left out by artists.

Because of her unique circumstances, this Marisa has the special recognition of being the first alternate unit in Touhou LostWord that is directly based on an existing alternate identity instead of being a completely different character.

* !post #7649236

title: touhou_lostword
body:
[b]Touhou LostWord[/b] is a RPG-style mobile gacha [[Touhou]] doujin game developed by NextNinja and Good Smile Company. It released in Winter 2019/20 for Android and iOS platforms. The global version was released in May 2021.

The game features most characters from the source materials, but also [[alternate universe]] variations of them, which becomes focus of the story.

h4. See also
* [[List of Touhou LostWord Costumes and Variations]]

title: aymr_(fire_emblem)
body:
Axe-type weapon from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

Aymr was crafted using the same technology as the Heroes' Relics, and made specifically to be wielded by [[Edelgard von Hresvelg]]. It boasts the highest Might among all Heroes' Relics in the game, and bearers of any Crest of Seiros can use the Combat Art Raging Storm. With it, a unit can move again after defeating an enemy, for as many times until Aymr's durability runs out.

Aymr is still present in [[Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes]], but has been replaced by [[Labraunda (fire emblem)|]] as Edelgard's axe of choice. It is an S-rank reward on Edelgard's route, serving as a powerful bonus weapon for her.

Aymr also appears as Byleth's Down Special in [[Super Smash Bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]].

title: areadbhar_(fire_emblem)
body:
Lance-type weapon from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

Areadbhar is one of the Heroes' Relics, tied to the Crest of Blaiddyd, and is therefore associated with [[Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd]]. It was previously wielded by his father, [[Lambert Egitte Blaiddyd]]. Wielders bearing any Crest of Blaiddyd are able to use a unique Combat Art, Atrocity, which grants greatly increased Might and Hit rates while dealing effective damage to everything. When the Crest of Blaiddyd activates upon using Atrocity, the resultant damage output ranks among the highest across the entire franchise, even moreso when dealing a critical hit.

Areadbhar also appears in [[Super Smash Bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]] as [[Byleth (fire emblem)|]]'s side special.

title: hatterene
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0858 in the National Pokédex, a Psychic/Fairy-type.

Much like [[Gardevoir]], it gained similar popularity due to its humanoid, feminine appearance, resembling a [[witch]] with a [[witch hat]]. Unlike the former, Hatterene is exclusively [[1girl|female]]. Because of the similar notoriety, it is also often paired with Gardevoir, typically as a rival.

In some fanart, Hatterene's "dress" (in actuality an extension to its "hair" appendages) is mistakenly depicted as the body of the Pokémon itself. Its actual body is disproportionately small.

Evolves from [[Hattrem]] (from [[Hatenna]]). It also has a [[Gigantamax]] form.

Japanese name: [b]Brimuon[/b]

title: peleus_(fate)
body:
Peleus (ペレウス, Pereusu?) was a mythological Greek hero, the father of [[Achilles (Fate)|]] and husband of Thetis. He was a grandson of [[Zeus (Fate)|]]. When Thetis tried to make her son immortal by bathing him in holy flames, Peleus opposed it, saying "Then that would destroy Achilles as a human", and thus one part of Achilles was preserved as human. Peleus was one of the [[Argonauts (Fate)|]], and [[Atalanta (Fate)|]] felt he was the only one who wasn't rough and violent and understood moderation. She calls him incredibly cautious, the complete opposite of his son. He was a gentle person who couldn't stand up against his wife.

At Peleus' wedding, Poseidon gifted him the divine horses Xanthus and Balius. [[Chiron_(Fate)|]]'s wedding gift to Peleus was Diatrekhōn Astēr Lonkhē. Peleus would later pass both of these to his son. When Achilles was young Peleus would tell him stories of the Argonauts, especially Atalanta who Achilles would grow to admire.

https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/List_of_minor_characters#Peleus

title: cistercian_abbey_of_fontenay
body:
The Abbey of Fontenay is a former Cistercian abbey located in the commune of Marmagne, near Montbard, in the département of Côte-d'Or in France. It was founded by Saint Bernard of Clairvaux in 1118, and built in the Romanesque style. It is one of the oldest and most complete Cistercian abbeys in Europe, and became a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1981. Of the original complex comprising church, dormitory, cloister, chapter house, caldarium, refectory, dovecote and the so-called "forge", all remain intact except the refectory and are well maintained. The Abbey of Fontenay, along with other Cistercian abbeys, forms a connecting link between Romanesque and Gothic architecture. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abbey_of_Fontenay

title: kai_saikota
body:
A former [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] affiliated with the 2nd generation of [[ChromaSHIFT]] when it was known as idol Corp.

On June 9th, 2025, it was announced she would be "graduating":https://twitter.com/idol_corp/status/1931909118370955469 from idol Corp on June 30th along with [[Coni Confetti]] and [[Nikki Rei]].

She is a [[dragon girl]] with a [[dragon tail]], [[dragon horns]] and  [[long hair|long red hair]] with [[sidelocks]]. Her outfit consists of [[jacket|cropped blue jacket]], a [[shirt|cropped fishnet shirt]], [[shorts|black short shorts]], a [[thighhighs|single fishnet thighhighs]] and [[black boots]].

A Puerto Rican, her streams occasionally fall victim to the island's notoriously poor Internet and power infrastructure.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #26195127: Profile

h4. External links

* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/KaiSaikota]

title: jacques_de_molay_(foreigner)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Jacques de Molay (Foreigner) (fate)|]] in her Third Ascension form from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Her eyes change from grey to yellow, her hair changes from white to grey, and likewise her skin becomes a dark grey color. She gains a pair of black horns that curve over her head, and she wears a very short black dress with a cleavage cutout. The skeleton around her hands and lower arms glow bright pink. Her goat familiar Baphomet becomes slightly larger and its eyes become a huge pair of creepy glowing pink circles. She doesn't have any legwear or footwear covering her legs. Molay is always accompanied by a huge tentacle that swallows and regurgitates her as her method of transport. Along with her tentacle, she also uses a larger set of stakes that look similar to the game's "Stake of Wailing Night":https://gamepress.gg/grandorder/item/stake-wailing-night material.

h4. Appearance
* !post #6765491

title: tohno_akiha
body:
Tohno Akiha is a character from the Japanese visual novel and anime series [[Tsukihime]] by [[TYPE-MOON]].

16 years old at the beginning of the story, Akiha is the head of the prestigious Tohno family and a student of the elite Asagami Private Girls Academy.

Her birthday is 22 September, while her blood type is A, height is 160cm, weight is 45kg, and measurements are B73/W57/H79. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a [[hairband]] and [[blue eyes]], Her clothing consists on a shirt with a [[bow]] and a [[long skirt]].

In the anime series, Akiha is voiced by Itou Shizuka while in the spin-off game [[Melty Blood]], she is voiced by Hitomi.

h4. Appearance
* !post #339033: Original
* !post #664976: Original (School Uniform)
* !post #2087010: Remake
* !post #8198382: Remake (School Uniform)

h4. See also

* [[Vermillion Akiha]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia Tohno Akiha":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tohno_Akiha
* "TYPE-MOON Wiki: Akiha Tohno":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Akiha_Tohno

title: a_better_tomorrow
body:
[i]A Better Tomorrow[/i] (Chinese: 英雄本色; literally "True Colors of a Hero") is a 1986 [[Hong Kong]] movie which started the "Heroic Bloodshed" genre of action movies in Hong Kong. The movie launched the career of Chow Yun-Fat, whose role as the Triad gangster Mark Gor defined badass, and established John Woo as one of Hong Kong's leading action directors.

Its most famous and frequently [[parody|parodied]] scene involves the protagonist Mark Gor lit his [[cigarette]] with a burning [[banknote]].

h4. See Also
* [[Chinese beaver (meme)]] 
* "Wikipedia: A Better Tomorrow":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Better_Tomorrow

title: kitsune_no_mado
body:
A practice from Japanese folklore where both hands are used to create a "window" gesture, which is then [[peeking_through_fingers|peered through]] to reveal hidden spirits, often youkai disguised as humans.

The gesture starts as both hands doing [[fox shadow puppet]]s. The hands are then rotated and opened such that the fingers interlace with each other, creating the window.

h4. Examples

* !asset #24230296: "The hand gestures":https://twitter.com/gazu100youkai/status/1000334485173387264

h4. See also

* [[finger frame]]
* [[fox shadow puppet]]

h4. External links

* "The Fox Window Game":https://theghostinmymachine.com/2021/08/18/the-most-dangerous-games-the-fox-window-game-or-how-to-see-ghosts/

title: tube
body:
Any hollow cylinder used to contain something. May or not may not have edges on either or both ends.

Note to be confused with [[industrial pipe]], which are used to transport stuff, not contain. Also not to be confused with [[innertube]], a kind of [[swim ring]].

If the tube is a named container such as [[test tube]] or [[bell jar]], use that tag instead.

title: martha_(swimsuit_ruler)_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. Summer 2016 variant of [[Martha (fate)|]], summoned into the Ruler Class.

Mostly wears a [[bikini]] with various accessories depending on her ascension level, such as a [[hat]], a [[sarong]], a [[Tarasque (fate)|]]-themed [[jacket]], and a pair of metal [[gauntlets]]. Uses her fists to fight. Summons [[Tarasque (fate)|]] for her Noble Phantasm a lot like how [[Dio Brando]] uses a [[steamroller]] in [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]].

While her base bikini design is the same in all three ascensions, her accessories and choker color change in each one.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Sakamoto Mineji]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Hayami Saori]]

title: statue
body:
A lifelike free-standing [[sculpture]] usually depicting a human, animal, or deity. Statues memorializing specific historical figures are particularly common. Statues vary in scale from life-size to colossal proportions. Small-scale statues are known as [[statuette|statuettes]].

title: sleeping
body:
Being in a state of relatively suspended sensory and motor activity, characterized by total or partial unconsciousness and the inactivity of nearly all voluntary muscles.

Often expressed in more cartoonish art with the presence of a [[nose bubble]].

Not to be confused with [[fainting]].

title: bukkake
body:
Bukkake (ぶっかけ) is a [[group sex]] practice wherein a group of men [[ejaculation|ejaculate]] onto a woman who is [[sitting]], [[lying]] down or [[kneeling]]. This practice was thought to be done serially; in manga and anime this may involve all men simultaneously. Use this tag when the body is covered by a large amount of [[cum]].

h4. See also

* [[facial]]
* [[cum on body]]
* [[Tag Group:Sex Acts]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bukkake":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bukkake

title: mcbling
body:
A subcategory of [[Y2K fashion]] with a maximalist, "trashy" look, primarily featuring [[animal print]], [[rhinestone]]s, [[denim]], and [[bling]]-style jewelry.

Common iconography includes the [[Playboy]] bunny, [[Juicy Couture]], other luxury brand [[logo]]s, [[Hello Kitty (character)|]], and [[dollar sign]]s. [[Sunglasses]] (especially large ones) are a popular accessory.

title: kako_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Kako[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]], [[messy_hair|messy]] [[black hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[ahoge]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[serafuku]] style composed of a [[white shirt]] [[midriff]] with [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is mechanical in theme and consists of her funnel and foremast on her back, two 20.3 cm twin gun mounts on her right arm, a third 20.3 cm twin mount on her left shoulder, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She is a [[tomboy]] and uses language that is "rough around the edges". She also has something of a lazy or carefree/careless streak. She seems highly attached to her "older sister" [[Furutaka (Kancolle)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #1964042: Base and kai
* !post #2037863: [[Kako Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]]

title: linkin_park
body:
An American alternative [[rock (music)|]] band from [[California]].

The band is currently composed of [[Michael Kenji Shinoda|Mike Shinoda]] (vocals, keyboard, piano), [[Emily Armstrong]] (vocals), [[Bradford Phillip Delson|Brad Delson]] (guitar), [[Colin Brittain]] (drums), [[David Michael Farrell|Dave Farrell]] (bass), and [[Joseph Hahn|Joe Hahn]] (DJ, sampler, programing).

[[Chester Charles Bennington|Chester Bennington]], one of the band's lead vocalists, passed away on July 20, 2017 after committing suicide. [[Emily Armstrong]] would later take on the role of co-lead vocalist after the band's reformation in September of 2024. Drummer [[Rob Bourdon]] left the band prior to their reformation, being replaced by [[Colin Brittain]].

h4. Tagged albums

* [[Hybrid Theory]] 
* [[Meteora (Linkin Park)|]] 
* [[Minutes to Midnight]]

title: makai_(touhou)
body:
The plane of demons seen in originally [[Touhou]] [[Highly Responsive To Prayers]] and the focus of [[Mystic Square]], ruled by the devil-goddess [[Shinki (touhou)|]]. [[Elis (touhou)|]], [[Sara (touhou)|]], [[Louise (touhou)|]], [[Yuki (touhou)|]], [[Mai (touhou)|]], [[Sariel (touhou)|]], and Shinki's bodyguard/maid [[Yumeko (touhou)|]] are known residents. [[Alice Margatroid]] originally lived here, but has since moved to the [[Forest of Magic]] in [[Gensokyo]]. [[Hijiri Byakuren]] was formerly imprisoned here within a subregion known as [[Hokkai]]. And many fans speculate that [[Koakuma]] is a former resident.

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

title: nelliel_tu_odelschwanck
body:
[[Bleach]] character. Originally incorrectly romanized as [b]Neliel Tu Oderschvank[/b], the former Tres Espada. She is also known as [b]Nel Tu[/b] and she is a small, good-natured, childlike [[Arrancar]]. She lives in the desert of Hueco Mundo with her adoptive brothers and former Fracción, [[Dondochakka Birstanne]] and [[Pesche Guatiche]], and their pet, [[Bawabawa]].

She can transform into an [[aged up|adult]] at will.

Often paired with [[Tier Harribel]] [spoilers]due to both having been the #3 Espada.[spoilers]

title: red_gundam
body:
A fictional manned robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Gquuuuuux]].

[b]GMS-α Gundam[/b]

The recolored [[White Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] [spoiler]when it was captured by [[Char Aznable]] of [[Zeon]] and revamped with an experimental Psycommu System (from the unproduced [[Elmeth]]) and 6 [[bit (gundam)|]]s armed each with a [[beam cannon]] (which also look similar to those of the aforementioned Elmeth). Banished without a trace at the third Battle of Solomon during the [i][[Zeknova]] Event[/i] (late U.C. 0079, early U.C. 0080)[/spoiler]. 

[spoiler]In U.C. 0085 the unit mysteriously reappeared, this time piloted by [[Shuji Ito]].[/spoiler]

In real life it was designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]].

title: the_beach_boys
body:
The Beach Boys are an American rock band formed in Hawthorne, California, in 1961. The group's original lineup consisted of brothers Brian, Dennis, and Carl Wilson, their cousin Mike Love, and their friend Al Jardine. Distinguished by their vocal harmonies, adolescent-oriented lyrics, and musical ingenuity, they are one of the most influential acts of the rock era. The group drew on the music of older pop vocal groups, 1950s rock and roll, and black R&B to create their unique sound. Under Brian's direction, they often incorporated classical or jazz elements and unconventional recording techniques in innovative ways. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beach_Boys

title: pokemon_clover
body:
Pokémon Clover is a rom hack of [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] FireRed collaborated by the various anonymous members from the /vp/ board in [[4chan]]. The project started out in 2014 as a simple reskin of [[Pokemon Frlg|Fire Red]], it has since evolved into a overhauled game, with the full game releasing in April 2020.
The main point of Clover is to be both a parody of 4chan’s imageboard culture as well as a parody of Pokémon as a whole.

title: gogmazios
body:
Final boss of [[Monster Hunter 4 G]], the expanded version of [[Monster Hunter 4]]. It is a giant [[dragon]] covered in [[petroleum]] and [[tar]], with a Dragonator (a siege weapon) stuck to its back. In-universe information is hard to attain due to the destruction it creates in human settlements whilst seeking out [[gunpowder]], its food source.

[[Chokmah (Blue Archive)|]], a boss in [[Blue Archive]], [[look-alike|resembles]] a [[mecha]] version of Gogmazios.

title: mullet
body:
[quote][i]Business in the front, party in the back.[/i][/quote]

A men's haircut that has waxed and waned in popularity since the 1970s. However, it is most associated with the 1980s, and it is considered the stereotypical male hairstyle of that period. The hair is cut short at the front and sides, but left long at the back. It has at times been associated with the rock and country [[music]] genres, lesbian subculture, and professional athletes.

A mullet with a narrow lock of hair tied or braided in the back is known as a [[rattail]].

h4.See also
* [[long hair]]
* [[undercut]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: maid
body:
A person who wears a western (specifically Anglo-French)-style maid uniform. See [[wa maid]] for traditional Japanese maids.

In anime, maids typically wear some variation of the classic French or English maid uniform (the former is primarily decorative, with [[frills]], short [[skirt]], and bib [[apron]], while the latter is usually an ankle-length or mid-calf length dark-colored dress with a pinafore apron). The most indicative sign that a woman is a maid is a white [[maid headdress]] and some sort of white [[maid apron]].

If a character that is not usually portrayed with a maid uniform is drawn with one, also add the [[enmaided]] tag.

h4. Examples

* !post #5454405: English maid
* !post #5909501: French maid
* !post #17584: [[Victorian maid]]

title: 9a-91_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[9A-91]] rifle in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair]], tied into [[low twintails]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and wears a [[blue dress]] with a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] front, exposing her [[navel]] and [[black panties|panties]]. She also wears a red [[scarf]], red [[beret]] and black [[thighhighs]]. She dons a red [[star hair ornament]] in her standard skin, a likely nod to her USSR origins.

Being designed around a suppressed weapon, 9A-91 is depicted as speaking rather softly. Many of her voice lines show her constantly seeking the [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]]'s attention and approval. In her OATH lines, she outright confirms this to be her one desire. She seems to be on friendly terms with [[AS Val (girls' frontline)|]] and [[AK-74U (girls' frontline)|]].

She is voiced by [[Nakahara Mai]].

h4. Appearance

h4. Skins

title: irish_flag
body: The national flag of [[Ireland]]. A vertical tricolor of green, white, and orange. The three colors in the Irish flag each have a meaning. The green represents Catholics, the orange represents Protestants and the white represents peace and unity between the Catholics and Protestants of Ireland. Not to be confused with the [[Italian flag]] or [[Ivorian flag]].

title: shuutai_(koihime_musou)
body:
An officer in the sequel, Shin Koihime Musō. Despite her small size she's a skillful warrior, wielding a sword that's as long as she is tall. She's quite fond of cats. She develops a huge crush on Kazuto, to the point of blushing profusely when the other members of the Wu faction tease her about it.

Her real name is Minmei and the real counter-part of Zhou Tai in real life.

title: electricity

An electrical discharge generated by a character, weapon, or object.

This tag does not include atmospheric [[lightning]].

title: toutaku_(koihime_musou)
body:
A character in [[Koihime Musou]]. The Governess of Dong province. However unlike her real life counterpart, who was a tyrannical and cruel man, she is a kind, sweet, timid and innocent girl who wants to help her country and her people no matter the circumstance. Due to her innocent personality, most are unable to say no to her as they are too helpless against her innocent pleas.

In the remake [[Shin Koihime Musou]], she joins forces with the Shu kingdom, becoming one of the strategists.

Her real name is Yue, she is the real life counter-part of [[Dong Zhuo]] who is a tyrannical and cruel man.

title: klepon_(food)
body:
A southeast Asian dessert consisting of glutinous rice balls typically filled with palm sugar and rolled in grated coconut. Alternate versions with different fillings may exist as well. Often they're colored green via the use of pandan or suji leaf extract.

h4. See also
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Klepon
