title: howto:get_started
body:
h4. Danbooru New Lurkers Guide
You are viewing Version 2 of the guide. The original guide [can be found here](/wiki_page_versions/733843).

[expand=Table of Contents]
1. [How Danbooru Works](#dtext-how-danbooru-works)
2. [Searching Posts](#dtext-searching-posts)
3. [Viewing Posts](#dtext-viewing-posts)
4. [Pools, Favorites, Favorite Groups](#dtext-pools-faves)
5. [Upgrading, Contributing](#dtext-upgrading)
[/expand]

Greetings, Lurker! You have just entered one of the most comprehensively indexed and moderated repositories for anime-related art on the internet. In this guide, you will learn how to take advantage of Danbooru's viewing and searching capabilities.

Please note that this guide only covers searching and browsing on Danbooru. Sooner or later, you will find out that you can also post things here. Please [b]stay with the tour guide[/b] and read the [[howto:contribute|Lurker's Transformation Guide]] after this article to learn more about the standards and good practices of contributing. Everything you post, including comments and forum posts, is regarded as a contribution. 

Use of the site is subject to the [[help:upload rules|Upload Rules]], the [[help:community rules|Community Rules]], and the [Terms of Service](/static/terms_of_service). All users are obliged to follow these rules for everyone's benefit.

h5. Don't need any introduction?

If you've already used [similar sites](https://gelbooru.com/), you may already be familiar enough with the booru format to not have to read the guide. Nonetheless, feel free to continue on. In particular, Danbooru may have different [[help:cheatsheet|search techniques]] and [[help:users|restrictions]] than what you may have come to expect.

h5. Using this Guide

This guide is intended to function as a jumping-off point for new users to learn more about this site. For brevity, features may not be described in full detail here. If a certain feature of Danbooru is of interest to you, links to the pertinent help article are provided under most sections, which describe the feature in more detail.

h4#how-danbooru-works. How Danbooru Works

Danbooru is, first and foremost, a database of art and information that helps describe the art. The anatomy of it can be described as follows:

* Danbooru hosts a collection of images, called [b]Posts[/b], where each post represents a single file. Pictures, [[animated gif|animations]], and [[video]]s are supported.
** Posts are described by a set of [b]Tags[/b], which are reusable, unique keywords used to describe the contents and subject matter of a Post.
** Posts may have one or several [b]Notes[/b]. Notes are primarily used to translate text within the Post without modifying the original image, as well as annotating elements of the image.
* [b]Pools[/b] are collections of Posts, used to keep Posts organized when Tags are insufficient, like in the case of a comic series, or a topic too subjective to be a Tag.
* A special kind of Tag is an [b]Artist[/b] tag, linked to an artist database entry, which contains the artist's current and former social links.
* Finally, there's [b]Wiki[/b] pages, which can be used to clarify the purpose and meaning of a Tag, or to provide further information about an Artist, or to describe features of the site itself (like the guide you're reading right now). Most Tags also have a Wiki page of the same name.

h5. Accounts

Several useful Danbooru features require signing up for an account, such as favoriting posts and excluding posts using blacklists. An account also grants you the ability to make edits and uploads, representing a starting point for new lurkers to become eventual contributors.

[b]Your privacy matters![/b] Danbooru is public and indexed by search engines. In other words, everything you do on here will be known to anyone who has an (uncensored) internet connection. This includes your favorites (by default), and all edits and uploads you make should you become a contributor. If you have a life to lose by having your identity associated with Danbooru, make up a fake name and use it!

To create an account now, click the red "Login" button at the top left corner of the page, then "[Create a new account](/users/new)".

h4#searching-posts. Searching Posts
h5. Further Reading: [[help:cheatsheet]], [[help:tags]]

[b]Two Tags Maximum: As a new user, you will be limited to two tags maximum per search, with the exception of some free metatags (see [[help:cheatsheet]] for a list). You can upgrade your account to remove this limit, see the Upgrading section below for more info.[/b]

Searching on Danbooru is done by inputting a series of tags, verbatim, in the search box at the left side of the [Posts page](/posts) (below the post gallery on mobile). To illustrate, instead of writing:

* A girl holding an umbrella
* A landscape with distant mountains
* A character looking back at me from behind

These queries should be expressed as tags separated by spaces instead, like so:

* {{1girl holding_umbrella}}
* {{scenery mountainous_horizon}}
* {{looking_back looking_at_viewer}}

Because tags in a query are separated by spaces, spaces in tags themselves are expressed as underscores [code]_[/code], so a search for [code]hair ribbon[/code] is equivalent to {{hair}} + {{ribbon}}, while [code]hair_ribbon[/code] is equivalent to the tag {{hair_ribbon}}. Symbols that cannot be easily input with a standard United States QWERTY PC keyboard layout are avoided in tag names whenever possible.

You can exclude a tag from your search by prefixing it with a minus sign [code]-[/code] ({{-1girl}}). Excluding tags counts towards your tag limit.

[quote]
[b]Pro Tip![/b] 
* While we do care about underscores being underscores in tag names, Autocomplete does not. Try typing [code]looking.at.viewer[/code] in the search box.
* Know the initials of a tag name? Write them in the search box preceded by a slash symbol to get to the tag at breakneck speed. e.g. [code]/lav[/code] -> {{looking_at_viewer}}
[/quote]

h5. Finding Tags

Successful searching requires knowledge of what the tag you're looking for is called on Danbooru. One easy way to discover new tags is to take advantage of autocomplete to find the name of a tag that you don't know yet. Try writing [code]cap[/code] in the search box, you'll notice that a variety of cap-related tags appear as autocomplete options.

If that doesn't suffice, go to [the Tags page](/tags) ("Tags" link at the top of any page). This page provides a full interface for searching the tag index. In the Name field on the Tags page and in the search box on the Posts page, an asterisk symbol [code]*[/code] is equivalent to telling Danbooru "anything can go here". Try submitting a search for [code]*on_another's*[/code] on both pages. What kind of results do you get?

To ease the effort of remembering the names of certain things, [b]Tag Aliases[/b] have been implemented for a large number of tags. An Alias makes it so when you type one tag, it is automatically redirected to the other. Aliases are useful for a variety of purposes, including:

* Synonyms or alternate spellings of a term, e.g. [[clavicle]] -> [[collarbone]], [[doughnut]] -> [[donut]].
* Alternate character names, e.g. [[Kyuubey]] -> [[Kyubey]].
* Translated names to original names, e.g. [[The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya]] -> [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]]. Danbooru prefers using the original title of a work as the tag name, with some exceptions.

Many of our tags can be grouped together in some way, which is where the [[Tag Groups]] come in. Tag groups are sort of like a directory or dictionary of Danbooru's tag vocabulary, grouped together by subject. If you know the subject area a tag lies in, but not the name, then consulting that subject's Tag Group should usually lead you to the tag you're looking for.

h5. Tag Qualifiers

When a single term refers to multiple things, the meaning must be disambiguated. Our method of choice for this is adding [b]Qualifiers[/b] to the end of a tag's name, enclosed in parentheses. Examples of disambiguated tags:

* [b]Characters[/b]: [[Mario]] / [[Mario (Cosplay)]] - character vs. dressing up as a character.
* [b]Character Names[/b]: [[Shimakaze (KanColle)]] / [[Shimakaze (Azur Lane)]] - characters with the same name from different copyrights.
* [b]Character Variations/Skins[/b]: [[Hakurei Reimu]] / [[Hakurei Reimu (PC-98)]] - two designs of the same character.
* [b]Diegesis[/b]: [[Photo (Medium)]] / [[Photo (Object)]].
* Some tags may have several qualifiers: [[Shimakaze (KanColle) (Cosplay)]].

h5. Metatags

As opposed to our traditional manually-submitted tags, Metatags are a way to search and sort posts directly by their properties, like score, size, status. They can be an incredibly powerful tool when used by advanced users, and can be combined together with regular tags as desired.

Some common searches involving metatags to try:

* [b]Explicit / Non-Explicit[/b]: {{is:nsfw}} / {{is:sfw}}
* [b]Group shots of more than 10 characters[/b]: {{chartags:>10}}
* [b]Desktop wallpapers[/b]: {{ratio:16:9 height:>=1080}}
* [b]Highest-rated posts[/b]: {{order:score}}
** [b]Recently[/b]: {{order:rank}}
* [b]Recent posts[/b]: {{age:<1mo}}, {{age:<7d}}...
** Combine with order: to create a "most x of the last y" search, for example {{order:score age:<7d}}.
** Or search with a greater-than sign, such as {{age:>10y}}, to [[steins;gate|travel back in time]].

h5. Excluding Posts
[b]Further Reading: [[help:blacklists]][/b]

Danbooru intends to be a comprehensive gallery, however because of this, it also contains content that some may find objectionable. Users are encouraged to add tags they dislike to their [b]Blacklist[/b], which excludes tags from searches. Your blacklist can be accessed through [b]My Account > Settings > Blacklisted tags[/b].

The blacklist is a series of lines, each denoting a query of tags that should be hidden. If a post matches any of the queries in your blacklist (i.e. would appear if you searched for that), then it will be hidden. A quick guide for composing a blacklist:

* [code]touhou[/code] - posts tagged [[Touhou]] will be excluded.
* [code]touhou -kirisame_marisa[/code] - posts tagged [[Touhou]] will be excluded, [i]except[/i] posts that are also tagged [[Kirisame Marisa]].
* [code]guro rating:e[/code] - posts tagged [[guro]] that are [[howto:rate|rated explicit]] will be excluded, other ratings will not.
* [code]brown_hair ~long_hair ~very_long_hair[/code] - posts that are tagged [[brown hair]] and [i]either [[long hair]] or [[very long hair]][/i] will be excluded, other hair lengths will not.

h4#viewing-posts. Viewing Posts
h5. Further Reading: [[help:posts]]

You may be already familiar with the Post listing view, as it is likely the first thing you saw when you visited this site. A list of post thumbnails will be presented to you. Clicking (or tapping) a thumbnail in the listing lets you see the post in all its glory, along with its details and comments. Below the listing is a set of page numbers, allowing you to continue further into your search.

Right above the listing, in the top right corner, is a handy button that allows you to adjust the size of thumbnails. If the thumbnails look a little too small, feel free to play around with the setting now until you find a comfortable size.

Next to the listing, on the left side (or on mobile, below) is a list of tags that frequently appear together with the posts in your search query. Try studying this list, you might find out about some niche tags you may have never thought of otherwise!

[quote]
[b]Pro Tip![/b]
If you're on a PC and interested in browsing more efficiently, now would be a good time to get accustomed to Danbooru's [keyboard shortcuts](/static/keyboard_shortcuts).

For starters, pressing the left and right arrow keys lets you jump to the previous and next page of search results, respectively.
[/quote]

h5. Tags

Tags are highly-reusable, unique keywords that describe the contents of an image. When viewing a post, the tags of that post will be listed at the right side of the page (on mobile, below the image and info sections). Generally speaking, if there's a visual or semantic element somewhere in a picture, then it's got to have a tag! Try studying the tags on the following posts to get accustomed to how tags on Danbooru are applied:

* Solo character illustration on a simple background: post #7225033
* Painting of a street with a crowd of indistinct people: post #9239857
* Abstract sketch utilizing mixed media: post #9522590
* Illustration featuring multiple views of a character: post #9590596

From the tag list, clicking on a tag's name will take you to a search for posts featuring that tag, and clicking the question mark [code]?[/code] next to the tag's name takes you to the tag's wiki page. Wiki pages usually contain information on what the tag is about and when/how it should be used, as well as closely-related tags. The number after the tag's name represents the total number of posts with that tag.

h5. Post Relationships
[b]Further Reading: [[help:post relationships]][/b]

Some posts may have closely-related posts. For instance, an artist may release multiple versions of an image wherein a character puts on different costumes. In these cases, we [b]Parent[/b] several posts together. Posts that belong to another post are marked with a [b]yellow border[/b], while posts that have other posts belonging to it are marked with a [b]green border[/b]. In the case of complex relationships, posts may have multiple border colors at once.

You may have already seen Parenting in action while looking at a post. When looking at a post that is part of a parent-child relationship, a box will be shown above the image containing other posts that are part of the family. You can then click on the thumbnails to navigate between these posts.

h5. Notes & Translations
[b]Further Reading: [[help:notes]][/b]

Some posts, particularly [[comic]]s, may have some translucent rectangles laid on top of the image. These are [b]Notes[/b], and hovering over them reveals the text contained within. Notes can be hidden by clicking (or tapping) the image.

Notes may be used to translate text without modifying the original image:

* A [[4koma]] translated to English: post #244234
* A [[finnish text|Finnish]] manga translated to English: post #1034157
* A translated comic using Embedded Notes: post #6319159
** Some translators use Embedded Notes, which often have fancy styling and embed directly onto the image without having to hover.

Notes may also be used to supplement information about the contents of the image. This is often done when a single image contains many references to other works or characters. Consider these examples:

* A character with a wide array of merchandise of other copyrights: post #8158469
* Identifying characters in a massive group shot: post #5869888
* A character drawn in a set of [[style parody|style parodies]]: post #8457607
* Labeling album covers in a [[record store]]: post #8082736

You can search for posts that have been translated into English using the [[translated]] tag.

h5. Post Details and Options

Below the tags list on the post page, there is the Information section, which lists additional info about the post:

* [b]ID[/b] is the unique numeric identifier of the post. This identifier counts up indefinitely, starting at post #1.
* [b]Uploader[/b] is the user responsible for uploading this image to Danbooru.
** This is not to be confused with the Artist of a post, which is usually denoted as a tag at the top of the tag list.
** Most posts on Danbooru are reposts by third parties, with uploads by the original artist being a rare exception. You can find those posts with the [[self-upload]] tag.
* [b]Date[/b] is the approximate date when this post was uploaded. Sometimes this may differ substantially from the date the original artwork was created.
* [b]Size[/b] is the file size, followed by the image resolution of the post.
* [b]Source[/b] is the place from which the post was obtained. Most often, this is a link, which you can click to see the original image.
** Sourcing is mandatory on Danbooru whenever possible.
* [b]Rating[/b] is a measure of how explicit the post is [[howto:rate|to Danbooru's standards]].
* [b]Status[/b] is the post's current status. Most posts are {{status:active}}, however:
** A status of Pending means the post has yet to be approved. Posts that are not approved in three days are automatically deleted. Posts that are pending for any reason are marked with a blue border in the post listing.
** A status of Flagged or Appealed means the post has been sent back into the queue because it has been flagged for low quality or a rule violation, or appealed after being deleted, respectively.
** A status of Deleted means the post failed to pass approval and is no longer visible from a typical search.
** For more information about post status and moderation, see [[about:mod queue]].

h4#pools-faves. Pools, Favorites, Favorite Groups

h5. Pools
[b]Further Reading: [[help:pools]][/b]

[b]Pools[/b] are ordered groups of posts. To view pools, visit the [pool gallery page](/pools/gallery) ("Pools" link at the top of any page). Danbooru offers two kinds of pools:

* [b]Series[/b] pools are primarily dedicated to posts that are meant to be enjoyed in a certain order, like a doujinshi volume, or a miniseries, or an exceptionally [[large variant set]]. Some beloved series pools on Danbooru include:
** [Little Nuns](/pools/16322) by [[diva_(hyxpk)|Diva]]
** [Emoting Mokou](/pools/11667) by [[Jokanhiyou]]
** [Monster Girl Encyclopedia](/pools/2206) by [[Kenkou Cross]]
** [Onii-chan wa Oshimai!](/pools/12768) by [[Nekotoufu]]
* [b]Collection[/b] pools are dedicated to gathering posts where tags would not suffice, for example for highly-subjective or specific concepts. Take a look at some of Danbooru's classic collections:
** {{pool:330|Clever}}
** {{pool:903|Disgustingly Adorable}}
** {{pool:1636|Fund It!}}
** {{pool:4068|Origins}}

Like how tags have [[tag groups]], certain pools have also been grouped together in [[pool groups]]. Pools can be searched using the [code]pool:[/code] metatag, which supports autocomplete.

h5. Favorites and Favorite Groups
[b]Further Reading: [[help:favorites]], [[help:favorite groups]][/b]

Each Danbooru account comes with a personal pool of posts called [b]Favorites[/b]. You can add any post to your favorites as you wish by clicking or tapping the [[heart]] icon below an image when viewing a post. Favoriting a post also automatically upvotes it, improving its {{order:score|score}}. You can search favorites using the [code]fav:[/code] (allows custom ordering) or [code]ordfav:[/code] (returns favorites in the order you added them) metatags. Clicking [b]Posts > Favorites[/b] will lead you directly to a search for your favorites.

Users can also create [b]Favorite Groups[/b], which are personal collections of posts. Much like favorites and unlike pools and tags, there are no limits on what you can put in your own favorite groups; it's left entirely to your own tastes. To create a fav group, go to [b]Posts > Fav groups > New[/b]. If you have a list of post IDs ready, you can paste it now in the Posts field (space-separated) and the group will be pre-filled with those posts. You can search favorite groups using the [code]favgroup:[/code] (allows custom ordering) or [code]ordfavgroup:[/code] (returns favorites in the order you added them) metatags.

Your favorites and favorite groups are public by default, but can be made private with an upgraded account. See the Upgrading section below for more details.

h4#upgrading. Upgrading, Contributing

Think you've had all Danbooru had to offer? We don't think so! If you frequent our site and love the content, why not upgrade your account? An upgraded account lifts the limitations on your browsing experience, allowing you to:
* Make more detailed searches,
* Make your favorites private,
* Make more expensive searches before the timeout kicks in,
* [b]and more! See [[help:users]] for the full details on what each user level offers.[/b]

Danbooru is always in need of more manpower to handle mis-or-under-tagged posts, writing and polishing wikis, discussing matters on the forum, translating posts and commentaries, and of course uploading new art! Learning how to contribute is relatively easy if you have some free time to spare. As for what's in it for you, users who make a high volume of quality contributions are likely to be promoted to a Builder-level account, which is equal to a paid Platinum account.

h4. ↪ Read Next: [[howto:contribute|Lurker's Transformation Guide (Becoming a Contributor)]]

Users can upgrade their account with a one-time fee. Consider your upgrade a donation to help us keep Danbooru on the internet. Just like any other site, there are servers to maintain. And we have to pay for our domain name, and for every byte downloaded from us!

h4. ↪ [s][Upgrade Your Account](/upgrade)[/s]
h5. Paid account upgrades are currently disabled.

For users who don't have the free time or will to contribute to Danbooru, a temporary option exists in the form of Platinum upgrade raffles. These are completely free to enter and occur every few months on the forum, giving away a handful of upgrades each time. You'll know when one starts based on the news banner across the top of the site.

h4. Go Back

* "Return to Information for Lurkers and New Users":/wiki_pages/help:toc#dtext-information-for-lurkers-and-new-users
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: firefly_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character from [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the [[Stellaron Hunters (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]] in Japanese. 

Known as Hotaru ("Firefly") in Japanese. Not to be confused with [[Lumine_(Genshin_Impact)|Lumine]] from [[Genshin Impact]], whose Japanese name is also Hotaru.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a light [[green hair|green]] [[gradient hair|gradient end]], [[two-tone eyes|two-tone]] [[blue eyes|blue]]-[[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts|medium]] (sometimes [[large breasts|large]] in fanart) breasts. Her default outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]]/[[white dress|dress]] with an inner layer [[green dress]], [[orange neckerchief]], [[black hairband]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]], and a single [[bridal gauntlets|bridal gauntlet]] on her left arm. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7726554: Splash art (with SAM)
* !post #7683192: [[Firefly (AR-26710) (honkai: star rail)|AR-26710]]
* !post #8035938: [[Firefly (Jepella Rebellion) (honkai: star rail)|Jepella Rebellion]]
* !post #7722234: [[Firefly (Vision) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Vision]]
* !post #9240494: [[Firefly (on the journey) (honkai: star rail)|On the Journey PV]]
* !post #9556115: [[Firefly (Spring Missive) (honkai: star rail)|Spring Missive]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Fireflies are such magical creatures, aren't they? They may throw themselves at a flame or suddenly grow old, but every night before that, they will shine brighter than the stars."

Member of the Stellaron Hunters, a young girl clad in the mechanical armor "[[sam (honkai: star rail)|SAM]]."

Born as a weapon, she's afflicted with the agony of Entropy Loss Syndrome due to genetic modification. She joined the Stellaron Hunters in search of the meaning of life, relentlessly pursuing ways to defy fate.
[/expand]
other_names: ホタル(崩壊スターレイル)

title: kostaltyn_(warhammer)
body:
Kostaltyn, supreme patriarch of the Cult of Ursun, is the unofficial high priest of the Great Orthodoxy, the name given to the unified cult that seeks to centralise the worship of all the gods of [[Kislev]] under a single religious hierarchy. Though there is considerable resistance to this change among many Kislevites of a more traditional bent, those who ignore the Orthodoxy's edicts risk being accused of heresy. To disobey the supreme patriarch of Ursun is to disobey Ursun himself, and all deemed guilty of such heresy will pay an agonising price. 

https://warhammerfantasy.fandom.com/wiki/Kostaltyn

title: elmer's
body:
Elmer's Products, Inc. or simply Elmer's, is an American-based company that has a line of adhesive, craft, home repair, and office supply products. It is best known as the manufacturer of Elmer's Glue-All, a popular PVA-based synthetic glue, in addition to other brands including Krazy Glue, ProBond and CraftBond adhesives, and X-Acto cutting tools.

Introduced by Borden, it was spun off independently in 1999. The company was acquired in 2003 by Berwind Corporation, a privately held investment firm. On October 5, 2015, Newell Rubbermaid announced a $600 million deal to acquire Elmer's Products.

The logo for the brand was based upon "Elmer the Bull", mate of Borden's advertising mascot Elsie the Cow, during the 20th century. Elmer's image continues to be featured in the company logo.

title: vittorio_cuniberti_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]] and [[World of Warships]] personification of the larger Maestrale-class destroyers and the 5th ship reveal and 3rd PRY ship.

Vittirio Cuniberti is an evolution designed from the Maestrale-class destroyers, offering her a larger profile to fit the new 12cm guns in a knifefight against destroyers in her peers, and Anti air guns to fight off Aircraft. She also comes with torpedoes that can be used in situations.

Her appearance is a dressed-up maid, alongside with a petite body

Caution: may contain "cunny" jokes as implied by her name as "Cuni" being Cunny.

body:

Its apparent [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart is the [[Coreflame (honkai: star rail)|]] of Oronyx: a stylized [[curtains|curtain]].

Its apparent [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart is the [[Coreflame (honkai: star rail)|]] of [[Aglaea (honkai: star rail)|Mnestia]]: a stylized [[butterfly]] emerging from a [[cocoon]].

title: signet_of_daybreak
body:

She loses the white t-shirt and wears a white towel over her shoulders, along with a white sun hat that has a red-and-white striped bow on it. Her Final Ascension artwork also has her holding a beer mug with a parfait in it. This is her only ascension to feature a necklace.

title: about:mod_queue
body:
The moderation queue (usually referred to as the "modqueue") is a system used to filter out images that do not meet Danbooru's quality standards.

All posts by non-Contributors start out as {{status:pending|pending}} and go through the modqueue. "Approvers":[/users?search%5Blevel%5D=>=37] look through the queue and approve posts that meet Danbooru's standards. Post that aren't approved within three days are {{status:deleted|deleted}}.

Contributor-level users have their posts automatically approved, bypassing the modqueue. You may be granted this privilege by consistently uploading high-quality posts while maintaining a low deletion ratio. The general criteria for Contributor level is having 500-750 uploads and having a recent deletion ratio of around 5% or lower, though users with very few deleted posts might be promoted at lower thresholds.

If a post is deleted and you think it deserves a second chance, you can appeal it. See [[howto:appeal]] for details. You can also ask for feedback in the "Upload Feedback Thread":[/forum_topics/7934]. On the other hand, if you think a post is poor quality and shouldn't have been approved, you may flag it to return it to the modqueue. See [[howto:flag]] for details.

You can view the posts currently in the modqueue by searching {{status:modqueue}}. Approvers may use {{status:unmoderated}} outside of the modqueue interface to see the pending posts they haven't made a decision on.

h4. See also

* [[about:upload limits]]
* [[help:upload rules]]
* [[howto:flag]]
* [[howto:appeal]]

title: about:upload_limits
body:
Upload limits are used, along with the [[about:mod queue|moderation system]], to prevent uploaders from flooding the site with too many low-quality images. You can see your current upload limit on your "profile page":[/profile] or on the "upload page":[/uploads/new].

Your upload limit controls how many {{status:pending}} or {{status:appealed}} posts you can have in the [[about:mod queue|moderation queue]] at once. For example, if you have an upload limit of 15, then you can have 15 {{status:pending}} posts at once. When you reach your limit, you can't upload more until your existing uploads are either approved or deleted.

New uploaders should be careful about uploading too many posts at once. If you run out of upload slots, you may have to wait up to 3 days for your posts to be deleted before you can upload again. You should focus on high-quality images that are likely to be approved quickly.

h4. How it works

* Each {{status:pending}} post takes up one upload slot.
* Each {{status:appealed}} post takes up three upload slots.
* If any of your uploads are manually deleted in under three days ({{status:deleted age:<3d}}), they take up five upload slots.
* Slots are freed when uploads are approved, or after three days if they are not approved.
* You start out with 5 upload slots for your first hour of uploading. After that, it increases to 15 slots.
* The number of slots you have goes up and down based on your approval rate:
** You lose a slot for every 3 deletions.
** If you have less than 15 slots, then you gain a slot for every 10 approved uploads.
** If you have more than 15 slots, then you gain a slot for every 10+2*N approvals, where N is the number of slots you have above 15.
** You can have a maximum of 40 slots and a minimum of 5 slots.

For example, if you have 15 upload slots, then you need 10 approvals for the next slot. If you have 16 slots, then you need 12 approvals. If you have 17 slots, you need 14 approvals, and so on. The number of approvals you need goes up by 2 every level.

At the maximum level you can have 40 upload slots. To reach this level you will need at least 900 approved uploads and an average deletion ratio of less than 5%.

h4. Contributors

Contributor-level users and above ([[help:users]]) have no upload limit. They can upload an unlimited number of posts and their posts are automatically approved. You may be granted this privilege by consistently uploading high-quality posts while maintaining a low deletion ratio. The general criteria for Contributor level is having 500-750 uploads and having a recent deletion ratio of around 5% or lower, though users with very few deleted posts might be promoted at lower thresholds.

h4. See also

* [[about:mod queue]]
* topic #16499

title: boxification
body:
A niche genre of fetish art in which character's bodies are compressed into roughly [[cube|cubic]] shapes.

In real life, this would result in broken bones, damage to internal organs, spinal injuries, and probable suffocation, so please don't attempt to replicate this.

h4.See also

title: cube_tom_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from the 1955 [[Tom and Jerry]] episode "Designs on Jerry".

The scene involves [[Tom (tom and Jerry)|]], having built the perfect [[mousetrap]], a complex [[Rube Goldberg machine]] with a [[safe (container)|]] tied to a rope at the end. However, Tom, filled with hubris, stands in the spot [[Jerry (tom and jerry)|]] was supposed to stand and the safe falls on him instead. When Tom comes out of the safe, his body is shaped like a [[cube]] with arms and legs.

h4. Origin

* !asset #24033114

h4. See also

* [[Cartoon logic]] 
* [[Triangle Jerry (meme)]]
* [[Boxification]]

title: help:flag_notice
body:
If a post violates the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] or is low quality, you may flag it for deletion. See [[howto:flag]] to learn more.

Do flag the following content:

* Low quality or [[off-topic]] content.
* Content that breaks the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]].

Do not flag the following content:

* Objectionable or potentially offensive content that does not violate the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]].
* [[Duplicate]]s. [[help:post relationships|Parent]] them instead.
* [[Paid reward]]s. Report them in topic #32324 instead. 
* Mistagged posts.

title: howto:appeal
body:
If you believe a post was unfairly deleted or deserves a second chance, you may appeal it. To appeal a post, click the "Appeal" link under the Options heading in the sidebar to the left of the post.

Appealing a post sends it back to [[about:mod queue|the moderation queue]] to be reviewed again by the "approvers":[/users?search%5Blevel%5D=>=37], just like flagging does. The post has up to three days to be reviewed by "the approval team":[/users?search%5Blevel%5D=>=37]. If the post is not approved after three days, the post will remain deleted. This process is the same moderation process that new uploads undergo.

Please keep your flags civil and follow the [[help:community rules|community rules]] when appealing.

h4. How does the system work?

* Every appeal uses 3 upload slots. You start out with 15 upload slots and can gain more by uploading.
* You can keep appealing posts as long as you have upload slots left. Your upload slots are returned when the post is either approved or it goes unapproved after 3 days.
* You can't appeal the same post more than once.
* You can appeal any post, not just your own uploads.
* You can use {{status:appealed}} or {{status:modqueue}} to see posts that are currently appealed. Approvers can use {{status:unmoderated}} to view posts they haven't approved or disapproved yet.

h4. See also

* [[howto:flag]]
* [[about:mod queue]]
* {{status:appealed}}
* "List of appealed posts":/post_appeals
* "Upload Feedback Thread":/forum_topics/7934 (only discussion of reasons, not appeal)

title: howto:flag
body:
If you believe a post either violates the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] or is low quality, you may flag it for review. To flag a post, click the "Flag" link under the [b]Options[/b] heading in the sidebar to the left of the post.

Flagging a post sends it to the [[about:mod queue|moderation queue]] for review. The post has three days to be reviewed by "the approval team":[/users?&search%5Blevel>=37]. If the post is not reapproved after three days, the post will be deleted. This process is the same process that new uploads undergo.

Just because a post is flagged does not mean it will be deleted. Anyone may flag a post for any reason. A flagged post will only be deleted if no one on "the approval team":[/users?search%5Blevel%5D=>=37] chooses to reapprove it after three days.

Please keep your flags civil and follow the [[help:community rules|community rules]] when flagging.

h4. Guidelines

Do flag the following content:

* Low quality or [[off-topic]] content.
* Content that breaks the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]].

Do not flag the following content:

* Objectionable or potentially offensive content that does not violate the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]].
* [[Duplicate]]s. [[help:post relationships|Parent]] them to their superior posts instead.
* [[Paid reward]]s. Request a ban in topic #32324 instead.
* Mistagged posts.

h4. Flagging Restrictions

* A user can only flag a post once. 
* Flaggers are anonymous to everyone except Moderators. If the uploader of the flagged post is a Moderator, the flagger is anonymous to them too.
* Users can only flag up to 5 posts every 3 days.
* "Approvers":[/users?search%5Blevel%5D=>=37] can flag (or delete) an unlimited number of posts. 

h4. See also

* [[about:mod queue]]
* [[howto:appeal]]
* {{status:flagged}}
* "List of flagged posts":/post_flags

title: zahard
body:
Zahard (자하드, "Jahadeu") is an Irregular and the famed "King of the Tower", the most famous and greatest being residing inside; he is like a "god" to the inhabitants of the Tower. Tens of thousands of years ago, Zahard entered and climbed the Tower with 12 Great Warriors. He is a High Ranker, currently retaining the 3rd spot in the ranking, and the overarching ruler of 134th Floor and founder of the Zahard Empire while still conquering the Tower.

Infamous for his prevailing immortality, he has become the prime target of FUG.

After the events of the Hidden Floor, Zahard came out of hibernation and is active once again, making him the highest ranked Active Ranker in the Tower, right above Urek Mazino. Due to his actions, Zahard can be considered the primary antagonist of the series.

title: neptune_(azur_lane)
body:
A British light cruiser added as part of a collaboration between [[Azur Lane]] and [[World of Warships]], based off of a conceptual design meant to succeed the [i]Town[/i]-class cruisers already in use by the Royal Navy. Improvements over her predecessors included a dual-purpose main battery consisting of 12 6" guns and an increased torpedo armament. The design was abandoned and no ship was ever laid down. Post-war budget cuts pretty much doomed the project, shifting priority towards "newer design":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minotaur-class_cruiser_(1947)] with rapid firing 152mm dual-purpose gun (which ultimately was also cancelled). 

Neptune is portrayed as a [[blue hair|bluenette]] [[maid]], her hair done into twin pigtails. She wields a trident, a reference to her namesake, the ancient Roman god of the seas.

In reference to her World of Warships counterpart, Neptune receives improved AP shells and a powerful heal.

h4. Appearance

title: red_hood_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of the ill-fated legendary [[Goddess (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Liliweiss (nikke)|]], [[Snow White (nikke)|]],  [[Rapunzel (pure grace) (nikke)|Rapunzel]], [[Scarlet (Black Shadow) (nikke)|Scarlet]], and [[Dorothy (nikke)|]].

The last Grimms model joining the Goddess squad. She's a bold and cheerful Nikke who loves old songs. Her red hair, red scarf, and red jacket are unforgettable.

She has a hobby listening to old music and consuming adult material such as erotic novels and dirty magazines. The latter tendency often got her into fights with the strait-laced [[Rapunzel (nikke)|Rapunzel]], who tried to curtail it.

[spoiler]She was formerly assimilated within [[Rapi (nikke)|]] but, as of chapter 26, has disappeared with no possible way of returning. [/spoiler]

Much like her squadmates, Red hood was named after the character from the "European fairy tale of the same name, albeit clipped":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Red_Riding_Hood].

Illustrator: [[mikan03 26]]
Voice actress: [[Hikasa Youko]] (JP)

h4. Appearance

title: my_little_pony:_friendship_is_magic
body:
A TV series part of the [[My Little Pony]] franchise that aired from 2010-2019 for a total of 10 seasons, mainly focusing on friendship and giving the ponies distinct personalities. The series was created by Lauren Faust.

It was designed to appeal to a broader audience by avoiding the usual trends of shows intended for children and girls, and occasionally has jokes that younger viewers would not understand. Because of this, the show has gained a large fanbase of teenagers and adults, and the crew of the show sometimes inserts jokes or references to these fans.

Originally only seasons 1 and 2 were dubbed in Japanese, but the dub picked back up (albeit with a new voice cast) starting in 2018 and is still ongoing, currently up to season 6.

For a list of characters, see [[List of My Little Pony characters]].

h4.See also

* [[cutie mark]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Little_Pony:_Friendship_Is_Magic
other_names: マイリトルポニー〜トモダチは魔法

title: princess_celestia
body:
Princess Celestia is a secondary character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]].

She controls the day and sun, mentors [[Twilight Sparkle]], and is ruler of Equestria along with her sister, [[Princess Luna]]. 

Several alternate personalities for her have been created by fan works. She may be depicted as an overbearing tyrant who banishes any threat to the moon, a glorious bastard of a prankster known as Trollestia, or an unstoppable nymphomaniac known as Molestia.

* [b]English CV:[/b] Nicole Oliver
* [b]Japanese CV:[/b] [[Inoue Kikuko]] (seasons 1-2), Makuta Yuri (seasons 3-6)
other_names: プリンセス・セレスティア

title: chouhi_(koihime_musou)
body:
Chōhi Yokutoku (張飛 翼徳, Zhang Fei - Yide)
Real name: Rinrin (鈴々, Lingling)
Voiced by: Miya Serizono (visual novel), Hiroka Nishizawa (anime)

Visual novel version
Chōhi joins Kazuto along with Kan'u after the two discover him together. Unlike Kan'u, who holds a more reserved Master-servant-like relationship with Kazuto, she treats Kazuto like an older sibling and calls him "big brother," similar to how she treats Kan'u. As a powerful character, Chōhi has the strongest Damage ability when used as a general in the game. However, she has no defense technique when used as a commander, thus making her unfit to be one.

Anime version
Chōhi is a talkative and always cheerful girl. Although she is small and very smart in some things, she is naive in others, yet very powerful and strong. She is one of the main characters and the first person to join Kan'u. Chōhi will also be very dedicated to her duty no matter what the cost to her (in one episode, for example, she fights bandits despite having a cold.) During the second season, she was opposed of Ryūbi of becoming Kan'u little sister as Chōhi was already made a vow with Kan'u to be her little sister but accepted when Ryūbi decides to make Kan'u her little sister instead. By the third season, she has accepted Ryūbi as her other older sister and even calling her Touka nee-chan.

Not confused with [[Chouhi Ekitoku]] from [[Ikkitousen]] series and the [[Zhang Fei (romance Of The Three Kingdoms)|historical figure]].

body:
Based on: Zhao Yun
Style name: Shiryuu
True name: Sei

She joins to the Shoku when Kan'u was fighting the Tō army, she fought alongside Chō'un for a while; when this war ended, Chō'un met Kazuto and took a liking to him, promising to join his army later. She joins alongside Kōchū after the battle with Enshō. She has a strong obsession of "menma":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menma. She also has a habit of running around the city as the masked hero of justice 'Butterfly Mask'. Strangely, no one other than Kazuto and Shuri can recognize her true identity, despite only wearing a mask.

body:

In the anime, she is a female federal lord that was the teacher to Gien, she decommissioned her from straining the promise that Gien would not draw her sword. Even though she has duties as a federal lord, she does do some leisurely activities ranging from drinking alcohol to attending and betting on horse races

title: gien_(koihime_musou)
body:
[[koihime_musou|Koihime Musou]] interpretation of Wei Yan (魏延), style name Wenchang (文長).

In KM, she uses the personal name Yanye (焔耶, read as "En'ya" in Japanese). She is Ryuubi's bodyguard and easily distinguished by her black hair with white streaks on the right side. Has a tomboyish personality and seems to take exception to any kind of behavior that suggests affection or attraction, whether from people, or animals (such as [[Ryofu (koihime musou)|]]'s dogs). Initially hostile towards Kazuto and thinks of him as a perverted troublemaker, until she is "punished" by Batai in a very humiliating way (Batai tricked Gien into a well prepared snare trap, and then tickled her). At first denying it, she eventually realizes she likes Kazuto.

title: chinese_empire
body:
General tag used to refer to all of [[China|Chinese]] history prior to the establishment of the [[Kuomintang|Republic of China]] in 1912, assuming given periods or events do not have their own prominent tags (ala the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]] period, 184-280). May be used with [[Chinese mythology]] when referring to the Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors.

Generally speaking, Classical Chinese historiography divides Imperial Chinese history into alternating periods of warring states and times when most or all of the China proper (as defined as the 18 provinces of majority Han Chinese population) were controlled by a single dynasty.

h4. List of Chinese Dynasties

* [[Qin Dynasty]]
* [[Han Dynasty]]
* [[Tang Dynasty]]
* [[Song Dynasty]]
* [[Yuan Dynasty]]
* [[Ming Dynasty]]
* [[Qing Dynasty]]

In contrast to her [[rakkun sutaru (old design)|pre-VTuber]] appearance, she is now a [[raccoon girl]] with [[red eyes]], and brown [[raccoon ears|ears]] and greyish [[raccoon tail|tail]]. She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], featuring [[red hair|red]] [[colored tips|tips]] or [[streaked hair|streaks]]. 

Her costume consists of a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[blue jacket]], worn over a [[white tank top]] (with her logo printed on it) and a [[black bra]], as well as striped [[black pants|black]] [[capri pants]] (or [[black shorts|shorts]]) with a [[zig-zag pattern]]. She also wears [[goggles_on_head|goggles]] on her head, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and [[blue boots]].

title: lockdown_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise, first appearing in 2007's [[Transformers Animated]].

While usually marketed as an evil [[Decepticon]], [b]Lockdown[/b] is often shown as a bounty hunter who is willing to work for any faction, even Autobots and humans. He is a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that typically transforms into a black and green muscle [[car]] in most appearances, although his appearance in the [i]Age of Extinction[/i] film depicts his vehicle form as a [[Lamborghini Aventador]] instead.

Lockdown's signature weapon is an arm-mounted EMP generator that can be used to immobilize and capture opponents; this weapon is often shown as a trophy taken from [[Ratchet (transformers)|]] in a previous fight.

Motto: [i]"Run all you want. It'll make the chase more fun...".[/i]

title: lugnut_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise, first appearing in 2007's [[Transformers Animated]].

[b]Lugnut[/b] is an evil [[Decepticon]], a powerful sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a purple and teal futuristic bomber [[jet]] resembling a combination of the Bartini Beriev [[VVA-14]], the [[B-29]] superfortress and the Heinkel [[He 111]].

He has a big red optic sensor eye in his head and two small red sensors at each side. Lugnut also has a mouth and what appears to be a very big, prognathic jaw. His main weapon is an explosive punch attack often referred to by fans as the "Punch of Kill Everything".

In Japan his name was changed to [b]Ragunatsu[/b] (ラグナッツ [i]Ragunattsu[/i]) and he adds the syllable "ttsu" (ッツ) to the ends of most of his sentences.  

Motto: [i]"All hail the mighty [[Megatron]]!...".[/i]

title: vellioth
body:
Vellioth, also known as 'Vellioth "the Martinet"' was a [[vampire]] lord in [[Baldur's gate 3]] who succeeded [[Donella Szarr]] and was later [spoiler]murdered by his underling [[Cazador Szarr]][/spoilers]. 

His appearance in fan art is "headcanon" (not official) as he is only seen as a skull after his death in the game. The most popular design shows him as looking similar to [[Astarion]] with long and curly [[white hair]] and the typical red vampire eyes. Most art portrays him as a [[dark elf|drow]] or a high [[elf]].

title: one_breast_out
body:
When one [[breasts|breast]] is exposed while the other remains covered or confined by clothing. See [[breasts out]] for when both breasts are exposed.

If the exposed breast is only partially exposed, the entire [[nipples|nipple]] and [[areolae|areola]] should be visible.

This tag most often accompanies [[open shirt]], [[wardrobe malfunction]], [[shirt pull]], [[bra pull]], or similar tags, but it is not a necessity.

Remember that just because you cannot see the other unexposed breast, it does not implicitly mean this tag should be used.  The unexposed breast could simply be blocked from view by the persons arm or hand, or the body of another character in the picture.

h4. See also

* [[breast slip]]

title: kawashiro_nitori
body:
The "Super Youkai Warhead". Stage 3 midboss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Mountain of Faith]], and later a recurring playable character. A [[kappa]] engineer from [[Youkai Mountain]] with the power to control water as well as a technology genius. Since kappas normally love [[cucumber]]s, she is mostly seen holding one (and sometimes a bottle of Pepsi Ice Cucumber). When first introduced she was depicted as shy and good-natured, but her subsequent appearances revealed a greedier and more outspoken side of her. She has [[blue eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] in [[two side up]] fastened with [[hair bobbles]], and a [[green hat|green]] [[newsboy cap]]. Her outfit is a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[blue shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[key necklace]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[blue skirt]] with [[pocket]]s, and [[blue boots|blue]] [[rubber boots]]. She often has her large [[backpack]], usually either [[blue bag|blue]] or [[green bag|green]]. A trend of drawing her with her jacket opened or removed to reveal a [[black tank top]] undershirt as an [[alternate costume]] has also become popular. h4. title: maizuru
body:
Maizuru is a character from [[Dungeon Meshi]]. She's one of [[Shurou]]'s teachers and retainers (as well as one of his father's lovers), and like most eastern characters in the series, has [[black hair]] and [[black_eyes|eyes]].

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/6f6cb9e5-6c37-4f43-a67a-b4145240591a/1]

title: sister_almonde_(nyantcha)
body:
[[Nun]] [[original|OC]] by [[Nyantcha]]. 

Raised in a covent along with her best friend [[Mikhail (nyantcha)|]] after being the only survivors to a [[demon|Devil]] attack. Once pious and gentle, a series of events have her lose her humanity and fully succumb to being a Devil. Has [[healing]] powers. 

Originally an [[Alternate Universe]] Almonder Jagger in a nun outfit that was a bit more demonic, she has since been expanded and rebooted into her own story, fully severed from the previous [[Pokemon]] OC ties.

h4. See also

* [[Almonde Jagger (nyantcha)|]]
* [[Baphomet (nyantcha)|]]

title: usb_tail
body:
A [[tail]] ending in a [[usb]] plug. Usually also a [[cable tail]].

h4. See also

* [[usb cable]]
* [[electric plug tail]] 
* [[mechanical tail]]

title: anakiss
body:
Alternate universe counterpart of [[Narciso Anasui]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Visually distinctive from Anasui for his different outfit, particularly his wide-brimmed hat with a feather in it.

His name, together with [[Irene (jojo)|Irene]], may form a pun: "I lean and kiss."

title: irene_(jojo)
body:
Alternate universe counterpart of [[Kujo Jolyne]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Visually distinctive from Jolyne for her hairstyle and outfit. Her outfit features heart-shaped cutouts and her hair, while retaining Jolyne's [[double bun]]s, is long and lets the back down.

Named for the titular character of [[Araki Hirohiko]]'s earlier work, Gorgeous Irene.

Together with [[Anakiss]], her name may form a pun: "I lean and kiss."

title: ace_trainer_(pokemon)
body:
A recurring trainer class from the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] games, dating back to the original [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]]. They wear sporty clothing and generally use stronger, evolved Pokémon.

Before [[pokemon_dppt|Generation IV]], Ace Trainers were called Cooltrainers.

title: monna_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
An NPC from [[Zenless Zone Zero]], she is one of [[Ellen Joe]]'s high school friends, alongside [[Ruby (zenless zone zero)|]] and [[Lynn (zenless zone zero)|]].

Monna has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[brown eyes]]. Being a [[cow girl|cow thiren]], she has [[cow ears]], black [[cow horns]] and a [[cow tail]]. She wears a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[blue necktie]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[vest]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks]] and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Zenless Zone Zero characters]]

h4. External links

* "Zenless Zone Zero Wiki: Monna":https://zenless-zone-zero.fandom.com/wiki/Monna

title: shaka_sign
body:
The 🤙 gesture. A gesture made with the thumb and pinkie raised, and the index, middle, and ring fingers clenched to the palm of the hand. Associated with [[surfing]] culture.

Also used to mean "call me" when held with the thumb near the ear and the pinky near the mouth. Also used to mean "six" in Chinese culture.

Not to be confused with these gestures:

* [[\n/]] (🤘) - The index and pinkie fingers are held out.
* [[\m/]] (🤟) - The thumb, index and pinkie fingers are held out.

h4. Examples
* !post #5974956

body:
Minor character appearing in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He is a young boy who went to the Holy City with his mother, [[Salia (fate)|]], attempting to seek salvation within its walls. title: yuzuriha_(jigokuraku)
body: Yuzuriha, also known as Yuzuriha of Keishu (傾主の杠, Keishu no Yuzuriha), is a criminal kunoichi that has been put on death row. After the shogun called for convicted criminals to acquire the Elixir of Life from the dangerous island known as Kotaku, in exchange for a pardon for their past crimes, Yuzuriha accepted the invitation to be a part of the competition mission. Upon taking the mission, [[Yamada Asaemon Senta]] was chosen as her assigned monitor.

title: washington_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s [[personification]] of the USS [i]Washington[/i] (BB-56). Character design by [[Zeco]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with an [[ahoge]] as well as [[grey eyes]] and [[headgear]] jutting out from the sides of her head. 

Her default outfit is a [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[blue necktie]] under a [[black jacket|black]] [[jacket]] worn [[off shoulder]] that exposes her [[bare shoulders]], a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]] with shin guards. Her [[rigging]] includes her famed nine 16-inch (406 mm)/45-caliber Mark 6 guns, plus additional 12.7 cm twin gun mounts at kai form.

She is usually depicted with [[South Dakota (kancolle)|]], oftentimes at odds with each other, a reflection of the rivalry the crews of the two historical battleships had. The rivalry stems from ill feelings by [i]South Dakota[/i]'s crew who mistakenly thought they were bait for [i]Washington[/i]'s attack in the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal where she severely damaged and sank [[Kirishima (Kancolle)|]] and [[Ayanami (Kancolle)|]].

title: uss_washington_(bb-56)
body:
Second of the [i]North Carolina[/i]-class [[battleship]]s of the [[United States Navy]], BB-56 was launched in 1940 and commissioned in May of 1941, shortly before America's entry into [[World War II]]. The vessel earned thirteen Battle Stars for combat service in the Pacific Theater. (Though [i]Washington[/i] did see service in the Atlantic Theater as well, primarily hunting for the battleship [[Tirpitz]], it saw no combat during that time and as such was awarded no Battle Stars.) The vessel was decommissioned for the last time in 1947 and sold for scrap in 1960.

[i]Washington[/i] was the favored flagship of American battleship commander Admiral Willis Lee, an Olympic marksman who became the USN's expert on radar-directed gunnery and the go-to commander for detached battleship divisions. The vessel is most famous for its actions during the [[Guadalcanal campaign]], where it engaged the Japanese battleship [[Kirishima (battleship)|]] in a close-range night action and destroyed it, one of only three examples of a battleship destroying another battleship during the Second World War and the only example in the Pacific. 

This tag is for depictions of the actual vessel, and personifications outside of established franchises. 


h4. Depictions

* [[Washington (Kancolle)]] 
* [[Washington (Azur Lane)]] 
* [[Washington (Warship Girls R)]] 

h4. [I]North Carolina[/i]-class battleships
* [[USS North Carolina (BB-55)]] 
* [b]USS Washington (BB-56)[/b]

h4. See also

* [[USS Washington (BB-47)]]: A planned vessel of the [i]Colorado[/i]-class whose construction was halted by the Washington Naval Treaty in 1922.
* [[USS Washington (SSN-787)]]: The successor vessel to BB-56, a [i]Virginia[/i]-class submarine commissioned in 2017.

title: marie_antoinette_alter_(fate)
body:
[[marie antoinette (fate)|Marie Antoinette's]] [[alter servant|alter form]], first appearing as an NPC in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s crossover event with [[Fate/Requiem]], [[Banjou Yuugi Mokushiroku]]. This form depicts Marie in the stereotypical "tyrannical queen" personality originated from various French anti-monarchist propaganda as opposed to her actual personality. She was released as an Avenger-class servant in the [[Id (fate/grand order)|]] chapter.

While her first ascension maintains the same proportions as her Rider-class self, her second and third ascensions have her appear [[aged up|older]] and with [[large breasts]] (resulting in her gaining 5kg). Like most Alter servants, she has [[yellow eyes]].

title: uss_north_carolina_(bb-55)
body:
The lead vessel of the [i]North Carolina[/i]-class [[battleship]]s, BB-55 represented a radical departure from previous [[United States Navy]] battleship designs with its greater emphasis on speed. Commissioned in April, 1941, USS [i]North Carolina[/i] went on to be the most decorated American battleship of [[World War II]], earning fifteen Battle Stars for combat service in the Pacific Theater. Decommissioned in 1947 and stricken from the Naval Register in 1960, [i]North Carolina[/i] was acquired by her namesake state and since 1962 has been a museum ship in Wilmington, North Carolina. 

This tag is for depictions of the actual vessel, and for original personifications outside of established franchises. 

h4. Depictions

title: world_war_iii
body:
A hypothetical large-scale war succeeding the [[world war ii|Second World War]]. The usage of weapons of mass destruction (WMDs), such as nuclear, chemical, radiological, or biological weapons is one of the major topics for the war. 

Since the US bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, marking the end of the Second World War, many more countries started to develop nuclear weapons. This caused extreme tension and sparked the Cold War. Physician [[Albert Einstein]] predicted WWIII will be so catastrophic, that the Fourth World War "will be fought with sticks and stones".

There were many close calls for a Third World War but, ultimately, the [[Soviet Union]] collapsed in 1991, ending the Cold War. Current flashpoints include the [[Russo-Ukrainian War]] and [[China]]'s expansion in the South China Sea.
h4. See also
* [[World War I]]
* [[World War II]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_III_in_popular_culture]

title: idolmaster_cinderella_girls
body:
An extension of the [[Idolmaster]] franchise designed for mobile devices, using the Mobage social gaming platform, in which you may raise and battle your idols against other players.

Cinderella Girls later expanded with rhythm game [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls Starlight Stage]].

In addition to the original iDOLM@STER girls, the game adds many more new characters, for a total of over 180 idols. These 180+ characters are then divided into three categories, Cool, Cute, and Passion. Cool signifies cool and beautiful types, Cute signifies cute and princess types, and Passion signifies energetic and sexy types.

The game was released November 28, 2011. It ended service on March 30, 2023.

title: list_of_eiyuu_densetsu_characters
body:
A list of tagged characters from the [[Eiyuu Densetsu]] series. 

[tn]WIP - the [[Sen no Kiseki (series)]] sections are very bloated and needlessly redundant. there are multiple ways this could be fixed but at the very least I don't think Sen I-IV each need their own section where they repeat the main cast (Class 7/New Class 7) multiple times. [[Hajimari no Kiseki]] exclusive characters need to be listed. [[Zero no Kiseki|Zero]] and [[Ao no Kiseki|Ao]] could probably be put into one section and I believe there are a handful of missing characters there as well. I plan to do all this sometime but I'm making this a public note in case any other Kiseki fan wants to take the initiative. Thank you.[/tn]

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Gagharv trilogy":#dtext-gagharv
** 1.1. "Shiroki Majo":#dtext-shiroki
** 1.2. "Akai Shizuku":#dtext-akai
** 1.3. "Umi no Oriuta":#dtext-umi
* 2. "Sora no Kiseki trilogy":#dtext-sora
* 3. "Crossbell duology":#dtext-crossbell
** 3.1. "Zero no Kiseki":#dtext-zero
** 3.2. "Ao no Kiseki":#dtext-ao
* 4. "Sen no Kiseki series":#dtext-sen
** 4.1. "Sen no Kiseki I":#dtext-sen
** 4.2. "Sen no Kiseki II":#dtext-sen2

[/expand]

title: eye_slugger
body:
[[Ultraseven]]'s signature weapon. A [[boomerang]]-like projectile, which functions similarly to the [[Ultra Slash]]. Also known as the [b]Space Boomerang[/b].

His son, [[Ultraman Zero]], wields two Sluggers, also known as the Zero Sluggers. [[Ultraseven 21]] wields the Vezard, also known as the 21 Slugger. [[Ultraman Omega]] wields an Eye Slugger of his own, known as the [[Omega Slugger]].

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Sluggers":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Sluggers]

title: incoming_kiss
body:
For when the subject appears to deliver a [[kiss]] to the viewer, or one appears to be forthcoming.

Not to be confused with [[imminent kiss]], which is between two characters and not the viewer.

h4. See Also

title: touhou_igyoukyo
body:
[[Touhou]] Igyoukyo ~ Grotesque Land Story is a series of videos made by Nico Nico Douga user [[Sushi Yuusha Toro]] (who also made [[Black Souls]]), telling a harrowing and violent story about and alternate version of [[Gensokyo]] and its inhabitants being hunted by mysteriously mutated creatures known as “variants”, and trying their best to survive in duels more violent than the [[danmaku]] ones in canon. It is well-known in the Japanese Touhou fandom, enough to draw some comparisons with [[Koishi Komeiji's Heart-Throbbing Adventure]].

h4. Characters

* [[Variant Reimu]] - A corrupted and twisted version of [[hakurei_reimu|Reimu]], with the face of a yin-yang whose two halves form a toothy, vertical mouth and the two smaller circles forming black eyes. She also grows metal needles on her back, which are used as weapons. Can seemingly only speak through clicking and clattering.
* [[Variant Marisa]] - A sadistic and extremely deadly version of [[kirisame_marisa|Marisa]], whose face is unnaturally blackened, with only her eyes being darker. Has no visible mouth either, but otherwise looks and sounds identical to "prime universe" Marisa.
* [[Variant Reisen]] - A beastly, monstrous version of [[Reisen Udongein Inaba|Reisen]] with a combat-oriented build, sporting heavy body armor and multifunction [[arm cannon]], although she still wears a skirt. She also curiously only speaks in broken English, like the other moon rabbit variants.
* [[Variant Yuuka]] - Deviant and sadistic version of [[kazami_yuuka|Yuuka]], who is attached to an amalgam of carnivorous plants. Her main body appears nearly identical to prime Yuuka, save for the suggestive clothing.
* [[Variant Keine]] - A colossal and monstrous version of [[kamishirasawa_keine|Keine's]] werehakutaku form with numerous extra limbs, eyes, and mouths. Her still-human-like head is attached to a long neck, although her face is twisted into itself, appearing as a spiral, until untwisted to reveal that she looks identical to normal Keine.
* [[Variant Mokou]] - A titanic, skeletal phoenix-human monster version of [[fujiwara_no_mokou|Mokou]] that is in a constant state of emanating a firestorm.
* [[Variant Youmu]] - A corrupted version of Youmu covered head-to-toe in heavy scars and with an extra pair of arms. Her [[konpaku_youmu_(ghost)|ghost-half]] has a sharp-toothed mouth and appears to have been impaled several times. Has yet to make an actual appearance within the series; she is mostly seen in standalone art of the series.
* [[Tina Flavor]] - An original character of the series, she is a tea fairy. Her variant version is highly deformed with long limbs, but retains certain clothing aspects and an association with tea.

h4. External links

title: wheel_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] turn himself into a [[wheel]].

title: inactive_account
body:
When the account linked to the source of a post has been suspended, deactivated, or deleted. Note that while this tag has a large overlap with [[bad id]], some platforms may keep posts from deleted or deactivated accounts accessible.

For [[bad twitter id|Twitter]], this can be detected if a post link shows the message: "This Post is from a suspended account".

For [[bad tumblr id|Tumblr]], this can be seen in the blog's URL, as it will have -deactivated appended to the end of the URL, followed by the date of deactivation.

h4. See also

* [[bad id]]
* [[protected link]]

title: north_carolina_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the battleship USS [i]North Carolina[/i] (BB-55).
Character design by [[Kishiyo]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]].

North Carolina is portrayed in the fairly typical fashion for Americans, being [[blonde_hair|blonde-haired]], [[blue_eyes|blue-eyed]], tall, and having [[large breasts]]. She wears a naval uniform-style [[white dress]] with a [[ribbon bar]], [[black choker]], [[black pantyhose]], and brandishes her namesake state's flag on her right shoulder as an [[armband]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6674002: [[North Carolina (The Heart's Desire) (Azur Lane)|The Heart's Desire]] (left). Bunnygirl costume, first revealed in the [[Azur Lane: Slow Ahead]] manga

title: rouse_card
body:
They are [[card]]s that appear in [[Kamen Rider Blade (Series)|]] and are based on [[playing card]]s (in the setting of the film, it is said that Rouse Cards were the prototype for playing cards).
Each Rouse Card is capable of sealing one [[undead (kamen rider blade)|Undead]].
The Ace card is set on the [[rider belt]] to [[Henshin]] the wearer.
Cards 2 through 10 can be scanned with a Kamen Rider's weapon to consume the weapon's Attack Points and exert an effect according to each card.
The Jack, Queen and King cards each add attack points when scanned with a weapon. When the Queen and “Jack or King” cards are set in the [[Rouse Absorber]], they power up the Kamen Rider into Jack or King Form.

h4. List

h5. [[Spade (shape)|Spades]] 
Cards owned by [[Kamen Rider Blade]].
[expand=List of Spades]
[table]
  [thead]
    [tr]
      [th colspan="4" align="center"]Table[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr align="center"]
      [th]Category[/th]
      [th]Name[/th]
      [th]Undead[/th]
      [th]Effect[/th]
    [/tr]
  [/thead]
  [tbody]
    [tr]
      [td][[Ace of spades|Ace]][/td]
      [td]Change Beetle[/td]
      [td][[Beetle Undead]][/td]
      [td]When this is set in the [[Blay Buckle]], [br]it transforms the wearer into Blade.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
      [td]2[/td]
      [td]Slash Lizard[/td]
      [td][[Lizard Undead]][/td]
      [td][b]Lizard Slash[/b][br][[Slashing]] the target by enhancing the sharpness of the weapon.[/td]
      [/tr]
    [tr]
      [td]3[/td]
      [td]Beat Lion[/td]
      [td][[Lion Undead]][/td]
      [td][b]Lion Beat[/b][br]Strong [[punching]].[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
       [td]4[/td]
      [td]Tackle Boar[/td]
      [td][[Boar Undead]][/td]
      [td][b]Boar Tackle[/b][br]Strong [[ramming]].[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
       [td]5[/td]
      [td]Kick Locust[/td]
      [td][[Locust Undead]][/td]
      [td][b]Locust Kick[/b][br]Strong [[flying kick]].[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
       [td]6[/td]
      [td]Thunder Deer[/td]
      [td][[Deer Undead]][/td]
      [td][b]Deer Thunder[/b][br]Attacks by discharging [[electricity]] from the weapon.[br]Scanning this with the console of the [[Blue Spader]] activates the [b]Thunder Spader[/b], which hits the target with its body charged.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
      [td]7[/td]
      [td]Metal Trilobite[/td]

title: almonde_jagger_(nyantcha)
body:
[[Pokemon]] [[original|OC]] by [[Nyantcha]]. A gijinka of a [[Chespin]]/[[Quilladin]] that came from a Pokemon nuzlocke called [[Project Life (nyantcha)|]]. Her boyfriend is [[Berserker (nyantcha)|]].

h4. See also

* [[Sister Almonde (Nyantcha)|]]

title: beetle_undead
body:
He is one of the [[Undead (kamen rider blade)|]] monsters that appear in [[Kamen Rider Blade: Missing Ace]].
He is  the ancestor of the [[Hercules beetle]]s and corresponds to the [[Ace of Spades]] in the [[Rouse card]]s.
He resembles the [[Caucasus Undead|Caucasus Beetle Undead]] except for the fact that his entire body is black, and he also shares the same features as him, using a sword called "[b]All Over[/b]" and a shield called "[b]Solid Shield[/b]."

title: stag_beetle_undead
body:
He is the [[Undead (kamen rider blade)|]] that exists in [[Kamen Rider Blade (Series)|]] and is the ancestor of the [[stag beetle]]s.
In the story, he is sealed away in the [[Rouse card]] "Change Stag" ([[Ace of Diamonds]]) and he never appears in person.
His appearance is completely unknown, but imaginations have been drawn of him.
other_names: スタッグビートルアンデッド

body: [[AI-generated]] content. Do not upload.

title: waluigi
body:
[b]Wa[/b]rui ("わるい":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E3%82%8F%E3%82%8B%E3%81%84#Japanese], Japanese for bad, evil, etc.) + [b]Luigi[/b] = Waluigi

[[Luigi]]'s self-proclaimed rival, introduced in [[Mario Tennis (Nintendo 64)|Mario Tennis]]. A sly, conceited schemer who secretly trains in order to defeat the Mario Bros., often competing against them in [[playing sports|sporting events]]. [[Wario]]'s partner in crime.

His trademark appearance is having a [[purple shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[baseball cap|cap]] that has an upside down "L", along with a very dark [[blue overalls|blue]]/[[black overalls|black]] overalls. He also has [[white gloves]], [[orange footwear|orange]] [[pointy shoes]], a thin angular [[mustache]] and a hooked [[pink nose]].

While thought to be Wario's brother due to early official English material, various later official sources over the years have confirmed that the two have no familial relation.

h4. Official Art

* !post #7938200

h4. [[Official Alternate Costume]]s
* !asset #25546823: [[Waluigi (Bus Driver)|Bus Driver]]
* !asset #27785021: [[Waluigi (Super Rush)|Mario Golf: Super Rush]]
* !asset #27785023: [[Waluigi (Tennis Aces)|Mario Tennis Aces]]
* !asset #25555456: [[Striker Waluigi]]
* !asset #25546828: [[Waluigi (Vampire)|Vampire]]

h4. See also

* [[Boyakki]]/[[Grocky]]
* [[Princess Waluigi]] ([[Super Crown]]ed)
* [[Warupeach]]

title: blay_buckle
body:
It is the [[rider belt]] owned by [[Kenzaki Kazuma]].
Normally it is just a [[belt buckle|buckle]], but when the [[Rouse Card]] "Change [[Beetle undead|Beetle]] ([[Ace of Spades]])" is set, a belt appears and is attached to Kazuma's body.
Next he pulls the handle on the right side, the buckle turns over (a “turn-up” sound is heard), and a energy barrier named the “Orichalcum Element” appears. Finally, when he passes through this barrier, he transforms into [[Kamen Rider Blade]].

title: princess_peach_(mystery_land)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] wearing the explorer-style costume seen on the Mystery Land board in [i][[Mario Party 2]][/i]. The outfit consists of:

* A tan safari / pith helmet with pink panels.
* A pale-yellow puff-sleeved blouse.
* A rose-pink neck-scarf.
* White elbow-length gloves.
* A brown belt at the waist.
* A full, floor-length pink skirt with a darker pink front insert.

title: princess_peach_(horror_land)
body:
[[Princess Peach]]'s wizard outfit worn on the spooky Horror Land board in [i][[Mario Party 2]][/i].

Peach swaps her crown for a tall magenta hat with a yellow star, matching robe-like overdress trimmed in gold, and wields a star-tipped wand.

title: thad_(nyantcha)
body:
An [[original|original character]] created by [[Nyantcha]]. 

A patriotic American construction worker and [[male stripper]]. Often dressed like a southern [[cowboy]]. His name rhymes with "Chad". He's frequently paired with [[Calgary Callie (Nyantcha)|]].

Full name [b]Thadeus[/b].

title: princess_peach_(pirate_land)
body:
[[Princess Peach]]'s pirate captain outfit from Pirate Land in [i][[Mario Party 2]][/i].

Features a navy tricorne with skull-and-crossbones, white puff-sleeved bodice, blue neck ribbon and a red sash over her tiered pink skirt.

title: inui_sajuna
body:
A character in [[Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru]]. She is a second-year high school student who goes by the name, "Juju", when [[cosplay]]ing. Her younger sister is [[Inui Shinju]].

She has [[pink eyes|pink]]/[[purple eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[crossed bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]]. She usually wears [[black rose]] [[hair flower]] [[hair ornament|ornaments]]. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[yellow bow]], [[red sailor collar]], [[white shirt]], [[black sweater vest]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]].

She is voiced by [[Tanezaki Atsumi]] in the anime.

h4. See Also

* "Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru Wiki: Inui Sajuna":https://sono-bisque-doll-wa-koi-wo-suru.fandom.com/wiki/Sajuna_Inui

title: dragon_dance
body:
([i]wǔ lóng[/i])

The [i]dragon dance[/i], like the [[lion dance]], is a form of traditional dance in Chinese culture and other Asian countries. It is most often seen in festive celebrations. The dance is performed by a team of experienced dancers who manipulate a long flexible figure of a dragon using poles positioned at regular intervals along the length of the dragon. The dance team simulates the imagined movements of this river spirit in a sinuous, undulating manner.

Lion dance is sometimes mistakenly referred to as dragon dance, the most significant difference is that a dragon dance is usually a lot longer, and operated via sticks. Lion dance often only requires one or two operators, who wear/carry it on their backs or with their arms. 
H4. Comparison
* !post #5041424: left: [[lion dance]], right: dragon dance
H4. Examples
* !post #8632676

h4.External links

* "Dragon dance Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_dance

title: lion_dance
body:
The lion dance is a a form of traditional dance in Chinese culture and other Asian countries in which performers mimic a lion's movements in a lion costume to bring good luck and fortune. It is is usually performed on big occasions such as cultural and religious festivals, important occasions such as business opening events, special celebrations or wedding ceremonies and notably the [[Chinese New Year]].

The [i]lion dance[/i] is sometimes mistakenly referred to as [[dragon dance]]. An easy way to tell the difference is that a lion is normally operated by only one or two dancers and has a tail, while a dragon is longer and needs many people holding a stick. 

H4. Comparison
* !post #5041424: left: lion dance, right: [[dragon dance]]
h4. Examples

* !post #7308651: operated by two people 
* !post #6961133
* !post #468503: operated by one person
* !post #5463241: Japanese version of the lion dance: [[shishimai]]


h4. See also

* [[shishimai]], Japanese Lion Dance.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Lion Dance":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lion_dance

title: year_of_the_tiger
body:
The Tiger ranks the third of the animals in the Chinese zodiac. Years of birth include 1914, 1926, 1938, 1950, 1962, 1974, [[1986]], [[1998]], [[2010]], [[2022]].

A [b]Year of the Tiger[/b] always occurs after an [[year of the ox|Ox year]] and before a [[year of the rabbit|Rabbit year]].


Online, many artists create celebratory art of characters that reflect the said animal on and around the Chinese new year. In the case of [i]the year of the tiger[/i], [[tiger girl]]s and [[tiger boy]]s often get depicted.
h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: year_of_the_snake
body:
The Snake occupies the sixth position in the Chinese Zodiac. Years of birth include 1917, 1929, 1941, 1953, 1965, 1977, [[1989]], [[2001]], [[2013]], [[2025]].

A [b]Year of the Snake[/b] always occurs after a [[year of the dragon|Dragon year]] and before a [[year of the horse|Horse year]].

Online, many artists create celebratory art of characters that reflect the animal on and around the Chinese new year. In the case of [i]the year of the snake[/i], [[snake girl]]s, [[snake boy]]s, [[lamia]]s, [[lamia boy]]s and [[snake hair]] often get depicted. 

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: year_of_the_rabbit
body:
The [b]Year of the Rabbit[/b] is fourth in the Chinese Zodiac. These are Rabbit years: 1939, 1951, 1963, 1975, [[1987]], [[1999]], [[2011]], [[2023]].

A Rabbit year always occurs after a [[year of the tiger|Tiger year]] and before a [[year of the dragon|Dragon year]].

Online, many artists create celebratory art of characters that reflect the said animal on and around the Chinese new year. In the case of [i]the year of the rabbit[/i], [[rabbit girl]]s, [[rabbit boy]]s and [[playboy bunny]]/[[male playboy bunny]] costumes are common. 

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: unicorn_gundam_banshee
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam Unicorn]] OVA (2010).

[b]RX-0 Unicorn Gundam Banshee[/b]

Counterpart to the [[Unicorn Gundam]] [[mobile suit]], designed with the motif of a lion instead of a unicorn. Built to the same specifications of the Unicorn Gundam, save the difference in color palette and v-fin ornamentation in [[NT-D]] mode. The Banshee is superior to the Unicorn Gundam in atmospheric combat, but lacks the La+ program plot device.

In the novel, it has been equipped with a Beam Magnum and the shield similar to the Unicorn's. However, in the OVA, it has been given an Armed Armor BS and Armed Armor VN instead of the former armaments. [spoiler] Later on, it is upgraded into Unicorn Gundam Banshee Norn, which are equipped with Armed Armor DE and Armed Armor XC, replacing the Armed Armors BS and VN. The Banshee Norn's Beam Magnum has a new attachment called the Revolving Launcher. [/spoiler]

[spoiler]Piloted by [[Marida Cruz]] and later [[Riddhe Marcenas]] (In the OVA however, Marida piloted the regular Banshee while Riddhe piloted the Banshee Norn).[/spoiler]

h4. Other variants
* [[Unicorn Gundam Phenex]]

title: sakaguchi_ango
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life essayist Ango Sakaguchi (1906-1955). 

He is portrayed with [[black hair]], [[grey eyes]], and [[glasses]]; his outfit consists of a grey-theme [[formal clothes|formal attire]]: [[grey jacket]], [[white shirt]], [[blue necktie]], [[grey pants]], and [[black shoes]]. 

In real life, he was often grouped with [[Dazai Osamu (bungou stray dogs)|]] and [[Oda Sakunosuke (bungou stray dogs)|]] as the [b]Buraiha[/b], the "Decadent Authors" of post-World War II Japanese literature. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ango Sakaguchi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ango_Sakaguchi]

title: beam_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|Kirby]] series where [[Kirby]] becomes able to fire a [[energy beam|beam]] out of a [[wand]].

In this form, Kirby wears a [[two-tone hat|two-tone]] [[jester cap]] with [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s at the tops that is half [[red hat|red]] and half [[orange hat|orange]], the latter of which is decorated with a [[star print]]. He also wields a magic [[wand]]. In some games, Kirby's skin also takes on a [[yellow skin|yellow]] hue.

h4. Icon
!asset #27780831

title: f90_gundam_(mars_zeon_type)
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam F90]].

[b]OMS-90R Gundam F90 (Mars Independent Zeon Forces Type)[/b]

After its capture by [[neo_zeon|Mars Zeon]], the [[F90 Gundam]] Unit 2 was extensively modified. More than 80% of the [[mobile suit]]'s exterior has been replaced, and the modifications were done with the aim of making it compatible with the maintenance/spare parts owned by the Mars Independent Zeon Forces (also known as "Oldsmobile"), and priority was given to parts with high wear and tear rates, such as the drive unit and exterior. 

In addition to the spike armor on the left shoulder and the exposed power pipe around the collar (which were meant to make it look more like a [[Neo Zeon]] MS) the sensors have been enlarged and apogee motors have been added.

title: yuzuriha_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is a cheerful young lady whose family has ties to the faction, Night Blade. She uses a type of Iaijutsu technique that is learned by descendants of her family. She affectionately calls her sword "Ayame-chan". Yuzuriha and [[Kido hyde|Hyde]] were once childhood friends until an unspecified incident occurred which split them apart from each other. Hyde, to this day, he still feels guilty about what happened that day. 


Yuzuriha is the only character to switch voice actors between the first game and its sequel. This is due to her original voice actor, [[Fujimura Ayumi]] going on indefinite hiatus in 2019. The role of Yuzuriha would then be passed onto [[Nabatame Hitomi]].

Yuzuriha makes a cameo appearance as a background character in [[Skullgirls]]. She appears in a stage called River King Casino.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]], [[red eyes]], she wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[red camisole]], [[blue pants|light blue]] [[skinny jeans]] that are often [[unbuttoned]] with a [[loose belt]].

h5. Voice Actresses

[b]JP:[/b] [[Fujimura Ayumi]]/[[Nabatame Hitomi]] [b]EN:[/b] [[Erica Lindbeck]]


h4. External links

* "Yuzuriha Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Yuzuriha
